jobTitle: Analyst, Customer Collaboration (CLD)-9
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Possible. You will improve value and service to your customer and improve supply chain efficiency. In addition, you will use internal and customer data to optimize plans and to support joint initiatives with strategic customers. How You Will Contribute You will: Create informative, actionable, and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement. Collaborate internally between Sales, Demand, Replenishment, and Supply teams to generate revenue while driving operational efficiencies. Provide reporting and analysis around maximizing in-stock availability goals while minimizing inventory levels for the total Walmart business. Be accountable for building and maintaining a collaborative relationship with the WM Dotcom replenishment team. Utilize Retail Link data to provide analytical support to Mondelez Customer Business Team and Mondelēz Supply Chain stakeholders. Develop and implement ongoing reporting and analytical processes to support the sales goals of the Walmart business while balancing supply chain efficiencies. Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues through root-cause analysis and data interpretation. Identify issues and maximize data availability to make recommendations that will benefit both our internal partners and external customers. Work collaboratively with Supply Chain Manager for Biscuit - to develop tools, reporting, analyses, etc. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Experience in CS&L and with customers Experience in fast-moving consumer goods or consumer packaged goods company Strong analytical and problem solving skills SAP knowledge and expertise in MS Office Customer orientation, strong communication and influencing skills Strong focus on delivering productivities, service, and KPIs Team player, accountable, proactive thinking, flexibility Key Supporting Competencies Customer Focus, Effective Communication, Influencing & Negotiating, Dealing with Ambiguity, Conflict Management More About This Role What extra ingredients you will bring: Customer Focus, Effective Communication, Influencing & Negotiating, Dealing with Ambiguity, Conflict Management. Education / Certifications: Bachelor’s Degree required Job specific requirements: 3-5 years’ experience in Supply Chain Management or Sales, 2 years’ experience in CPFR Proficient in ADF, SAP, Microsoft Office, Microsoft Excel, and Tableau Travel requirements: less than 10% Within Country Relocation support available and for candidates voluntarily moving internationally some minimal support is offered through our Volunteer International Transfer Policy Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. For office-based, salaried roles at Bakery and Customer Service & Logistics locations, and some remote roles proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required to be eligible for employment. Religious, medical and/or other accommodations as required by law will be considered on a case by case basis. You may review the Mondelēz COVID vaccination policy by visiting the US careers website at https://www.mondelezinternational.com/United-States. jobTitle: Analytics Manager
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. Together with analytics team leaders you will support our business with excellent data models to uncover trends that can drive long-term business results. How You Will Contribute You will: Work in close partnership with the business leadership team to execute the analytics agenda Identify and incubate best-in-class external partners to drive delivery on strategic projects Develop custom models/algorithms to uncover signals/patterns and trends to drive long-term business performance Execute the business analytics program agenda using a methodical approach that conveys to stakeholders what business analytics will deliver What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Using data analysis to make recommendations to senior leaders Technical experience in roles in best-in-class analytics practices Experience deploying new analytical approaches in a complex and highly matrixed organization Savvy in usage of the analytics techniques to create business impacts The Analytics Manager will design, develop, and automate scalable solutions for the Mondelēz International Global Risk Management team to create efficiencies, streamline processes, and support better decision making by translating operational performance into financial impact to the business. Responsibilities: Use data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and dependencies Organize and transform information into user-friendly, interactive, and insightful reports, dashboards, or other visualizations Assist business users with using published reports/dashboards to predict trends that identify cost drivers and help guide risk management strategy Connect operational processes to financial results with limited direction Pull data from various sources to present total cost of risk metrics to senior management or customers Build automation and additional efficiencies into manual reporting efforts Monitor quality control and work closely with internal/external colleagues to collect, validate, and migrate data as needed Investigate data from multiple angles and work with stakeholders across organization to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive loss prevention efforts. Support the global risk management team from the standpoint of ad-hoc reporting requests, complex queries, general education, and other projects Act as intermediary with service providers to resolve data issues Work with appropriate stakeholders to validate SOC 1 or other compliance tool(s) for compliance with internal SOX controls Work with stakeholders to validate vendor compliance with GDPR standards, or other local compliance standards as identified by local country requirements Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Data Science, or similar field 5 or more years of experience with Tableau, Power BI, and other popular BI publishing tools Experience connecting global datasets and transforming data for business intelligence Strong Data Science, Finance, Mathematics, or similar background Outstanding analytical mindset Understands collection of data and concepts behind relational databases Ability to communicate complex ideas to any audience Ability to automate and simplify existing processes Ability to effectively manage competing priorities In-depth knowledge of statistical methodologies and data analysis techniques No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. jobTitle: Associate Human Resources Business Partner, People and Education and Training Lead
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Possible. Our employees are key ingredients to our success, and you will be responsible for HR support to a specific plant(s) on topics such as talent management, leadership development, early career programs, career pathing, mobility and strategic talent reviews. For people managers in specific plants, you will act as point of contact for specific HR topics. You are a trusted partner and will drive implementation of global strategies and initiatives across plants. You will be responsible for influencing business strategy for people-related issues. How You Will Contribute You will: Partner and build relationships with key stakeholders, understanding the commercial/supply chain impact of people decisions in order to fulfil business objectives, providing an outside-in lens (plant roadmap, people plan, factory of the future) Oversee site labor relations strategy including elements of communication and works council relations and compliance Drive engagement on the plant culture agenda; coach leaders on the key cultural elements and organizational values – being the custodian of high performance work systems, and ensure an effective plant learning management Partner with leadership teams on strategic priorities from workforce planning insights and decisions to talent acquisition, leadership development, early career programs, career pathing, succession planning and mobility, and strategic talent reviews Leverage data analytics to drive solutions and decisions that translate into actionable plans to impact the bottom line and enable business strategy. Inform and update People Services of any local, legal and regulatory changes in market Support plant leadership with effective management of time and attendance systems and attendance policies as necessary, coaching plant directors and plant leadership pillar in line with plant needs/KPI’s – support performance calibration where applicable Lead people process’/impact of any plant transformation with effective change management What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in: Broad generalist HR experience across a range of populations and range of seniority Strong experience of working with trade unions to deliver change Proven track record as a trusted, credible business partner with ability to engage, inspire, and influence people Experience working with Lean Six Sigma to drive high performance HR leader with an active curiosity, insight orientation and external perspective about people and business performance Interpersonal savvy, planning, and dealing with ambiguity Future focused by thinking ahead and anticipating new opportunities, leverages an outside in perspective through understanding of market trends Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree required in Business Administration, Human Resources or related field 3 or more years of training knowledge and experience is required 2 or more years of HR Generalist experience Manufacturing experience is preferred Org development experience is ideal Experience in a unionized facility is strongly preferred Bilingual in Spanish preferred Labor Relations experience is preferred Strong facilitation and presentation skills, with the ability to relate to people in all parts of the plant and organization The position requires strong influencing skills as much of their success will be through others Excellent communication skills (written & oral) Ability to assist managers in writing logical, well thought out disciplinary memos and performance plans A “boots” on the ground approach with engagement with hourly and salaried colleagues No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. jobTitle: Automation Controls Engineer
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. As expert you will bring a deep technical mastery of the process and equipment. That expertise allows you to lead the planning, process development and implementation of Planned Maintenance Elements in a Continuous Improvement manufacturing environment. You will manage this through teams consisting of various technical and non-technical personnel, key support contractors and operations personnel. How You Will Contribute You will: Partner & Enable the line leader(s) to deliver the SQCDSM targets-Safety, Quality, Cost, Delivery, Sustainability & Morale for the lines, to ensure Process stability; Participates in the DMS- Daily Management systems meetings at the shift and line level Own the technology and process and centerline settings for the equipment and process and have deep technical mastery of the process and equipment; Owns the PM-Progressive maintenance systems and work processes and the PM-Progressive Maintenance Key Performance Indicators for the line/s along with Centerline Management systems; owns the R&M-Repairs & Maintenance budget of the line Develop, own and execute the line/s preventive and time-based maintenance systems and plans and build capability of the team to execute themselves; Build (spends at least 50% of time) technical and maintenance skills of the technicians working in the shifts, so that they are able to operate and maintain their equipment themselves; be part of the PM Pillar, own all PM systems and work process at the line level and lead some of them at the department level Partner with the Asset and Reliability team for system improvement and execution of special maintenance tasks; be responsible for Change Management on the line/s, localization of spares and proper break-down analysis and R&M cost reduction for the line/s; Represents the department/line/s as the site technology owner in the regional and global technology forums Assist in VSU for the new initiatives and enable the VSU team; Help the line leader in internal and external benchmarking and reapplication; be the subject matter expert on one of the component categories and be a trainer of PM related subjects for the plant What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Advanced knowledge (including AM-Autonomous Maintenance Step 4 systems & Progressive Maintenance Step 3) & skill to maintain the dedicated equipment(s)at basic conditions independently, including the execution of AM & PM (BD-Breakdown maintenance, planned maintenance) standards on dedicated equipment(s) and TPM - Phase 3 & 4 tools problem solving tools The capability to lead a Role for the Line. Qualify and coach the next level SWP owners and drive the common opportunity areas across the line in PDCA-Plan Do Check Adjust approach The capability to work as the Line Leader, developing and aligning goal/master plan for the line, deploying and managing IDP for the members, coaching team members on their performance management and career development Education / Certifications: Bachelors Degree Required Job specific requirements: Minimum 3 years of experience in Engineering experience preferred in food industry Minimum 3 years of experience in Project Management, Power distribution and Electrical safety, VFD’s, Servo’s and motion control system, PLC/HMI, control system network, instrumentation and automation Minimum 2 years of experience in Knowledge of Integrated Lean 6 Sigma, ISC relevant experience, proficiency in SAP, Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook, Power Point, AutoCAD Possesses excellent organizational agility; quickly identifies and able to prioritize to reduce or eliminate plant downtime, constantly works to achieve results Benefits Starting on Day 1: Medical, Dental and Vision with different coverage options. Basic life and short-term disability Insurance (STD). 401(k) Savings Plan Paid time off (PTO) No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. For office-based, salaried roles at Bakery and Customer Service & Logistics locations, and some remote roles proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required to be eligible for employment. Religious, medical and/or other accommodations as required by law will be considered on a case by case basis. You may review the Mondelēz COVID vaccination policy by visiting the US careers website at https://www.mondelezinternational.com/United-States. jobTitle: Automation Lead
jobDescription: Job Description Manufacturing As part of Manufacturing, you’ll use your skills, our production lines, distribution center, ingredient handling to help create the delicious finished products our consumers love. While taking ownership in your area of work, you’ll also ensure the safety of yourself and your colleagues while producing our top-quality products reliably and efficiently within our integrated supply chain. Job Functions Overall responsibility will be to work with each of the multidisciplinary teams, automation upgrade and process visualization systems; supervise electrical activities, training, and trouble-shooting electrical issues, including PLC or networks related. Utilize and improve current technology to provide continuous improvement to all maintenance and operation’s effectiveness. Provide support, planning, direction and supervision to electrical team members. Program responsibility to include executing preventative/predictive maintenance, corrective maintenance, and equipment overhauls and upgrades as it pertains to the plant electrical systems. Key Responsibilities Digital Transformation Improve data content on actual applications based on plant requirements Train team members on the capabilities of digital tools implemented Technical lead Provide technical support for maintenance team during assigned shift and on call support off shifts as required leading troubleshooting Support root cause analysis with process data Supervise electrical and control work performed by contractors and electricians Coordinate with other departments to resolve electrical issues Implement disaster recovery plan for critical equipment Support to engineering projects IL6S Responsible of planning and follow up of electrical activities Ensure execution of preventive maintenance schedules for electrical distribution system, control equipment and instrumentation using CMMS Ensure execution of maintenance and inspection plans to ensure reliability, sustainability and security of electrical distribution infrastructure using CMMS Qualifications Experience on Food industry experience. Preferable in Mondelēz projects. Proficient troubleshooting skills Proficiency in working PLC’s Allen-Bradley all families VFDs Allen-Bradley and Toshiba HMI’s Allen-Bradley Industrial communication networks; Ethernet, DH+, RIO & ControlNet Understanding of Distributed Control Systems (DCS) and server/client system Experience with industrial power & control circuits Experience with industrial instrumentation Ability to read and understand schematics and electrical drawings. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work with minimal supervision and function effectively in a highly demanding environment. Ability to interact effectively with outside vendors, production operators, team leads, and the maintenance trades. Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (Mechatronic / Electronic) Maintenance background strongly preferred Technical supervision experience Electrical license is preferred Special Requirements Spanish / English conversational Ability to work any shift and overtime. On call for consultation during other shifts. More About This Role Education / Certifications: Experience on Food industry experience. Preferable in Mondelēz projects. Proficiency in working with Allen-Bradley PLC’s using RS Logix software Understanding of Distributed Control Systems (DCS) and server/client system Experience with industrial power & control circuits Experience with industrial instrumentation Experience with industrial communication networks; Fieldbus, Ethernet, & ControlNet. Experience with AC & DC drives Allen-Bradley & Toshiba. Ability to read and understand schematics and electrical drawings. Proficient troubleshooting skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work with minimal supervision and function effectively in a highly demanding environment. Ability to interact effectively with outside vendors, production operators, team leads, and the maintenance trades. Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (Mechatronic / Electronic) Maintenance background strongly preferred Technical supervision experience Oregon's electrical license is preferred  English / Spanish required Work schedule: Open to work on 1st, 2nd or 3rd shift No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Brand Manager, Trident Gum
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. Brand Manager, Gum (Dentyne, Trident) will be responsible for developing and executing the Trident brand’s strategies across equity, portfolio, quality, price, communication, and activation plans. Ensures category P&L delivery by actively participating in the IBP process and ensuring efficient execution of the launch plan, programming tactics, and making informed prioritization and resource allocation decisions. This will require working across creative agencies, managing the cross functional community, and seamless sales linkage to drive business performance. Key Responsibilities Drive P&L / category financial performance management by partnering with sales, finance, and end-to-end planning organization to ensure delivery of annual contract commitments (challenging assumptions, understanding, and telling the story of the category results, and assessing risks and opportunities, etc.) Work with internal and external partners (sales and Nielsen) to identify brand and category trends to inform brand health and business strategy. Lead the development and execution of integrated communication, activation and media plans, maximizing Media ROI, working with internal and external media partners Brief and support national shopper marketing programs, including strategic briefing and creative oversight Partner with Consumer Insights to deliver key communications/media testing, measurement, and on-going optimization Cooperate with sales planning, customer teams and shopper marketing to ensure growth across channels Manage Gum A&C budget in line with the target Partner with integrated supply chain, research & development, quality, etc. to ensure flawless execution of the plans Deliver renovation & growth commercialization projects from ideation through launch Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree is required; Master’s Degree preferred Minimum of 5 years' work experience or equivalent; brand marketing experience required; CPG specific experience highly preferred Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving capabilities Ability to thrive in and handle ambiguity & fast paced environment Analytic and creative thinking skills Strong business acumen and marketing capabilities Strong leadership / communication / collaboration skills Demonstrated track record of sales/marketing/commercialization execution No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Bus Unit Mgr
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. You will lead the production operations in the Plant and delivering key performance targets (SQCDSM) in safety, quality, productivity, volumes, cost, sustainability, organizational morale. You will ensure our manufacturing strategy is implemented and is fully effective and you will strive to build a high performing organization. How You Will Contribute You will: Manages change/ transformation change/ transformation amongst the Operating teams in the implementation of IL6S-Integrated Lean 6 sigma phase journey, FoF-Factory of Future Line centric organization & roles (AM-Autonomous Maintenance, PM-Progressive Maintenance and an integrated 6 star model within operating Line teams) to progress into Self sufficient teams. Role models Values and principles through effective coaching, mentoring and development of the team. Support the Manufacturing annual operational plans and targets to meet Safety, Quality, Cost, Delivery, Sustainability, Engagement goals in line with the site Compelling business need. coach Line Leaders, cascade & communicate the plans and targets to employees to ensure alignment and understanding around priorities, focus and KPI’s. Lead and be Accountable to establish a strong Governance to Review, Control Operational performance and Continuous Improvement plan and embed a zero loss mindset to constantly improve and deliver against best in class both internally and externally. Drive the Operating team to identify and manage improvements to technology, culture, capability and operating systems to deliver a best practice and reliable operation. Support all Manufacturing standards, Governance, Compliance requirements (e.g. Corporate Quality, Food safety & GMP, Health, Safety, Security, Environment, Sustainability, Code of conduct, Policies & principles, Operational standards, Local legal requirements, Internal Audit norms, & other procedures updated from time to time) are in place, understood by all, and is regularly reviewed and monitored for effective implementation. Lead and be Accountable for Talent, Capabilities & Engagement for the Manufacturing team - identify and implement critical levers to attract, retain & develop critical talent and builds capability at all levels, technical and behavioral, to build a sustainable workforce profile for the future. Partner effectively with all multi-functional peers internally & externally (outside the plant) to achieve objectives, goals and KPI’s. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Strong operational & manufacturing leadership experience in CPG industry with experience in TPM-Total productive maintenance, 5s, LEAN, 6 sigma tools and concepts Excellent communication (verbal & written), coaching, and leadership skills in a team-based environment. Demonstrated abilities in Analytics, problem solving and team building An Engineer with a strong financial & business acumen, project management skills and Knowledge of industrial maintenance and manufacturing equipment. You will lead the production operations in the Plant and delivering key performance targets (SQCDSM) in safety, quality, productivity, volumes, cost, sustainability, organizational morale. jobTitle: Corporate Governance Specialist and Meeting Coordinator
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter. Corporate Governance Specialist and Meeting Coordinator Scope This position offers an excellent opportunity for a motivated and capable individual to utilize their knowledge of company’s operations and expert skills to provide high-level organizational support for the Mondelez International (MDLZ) Board of Directors, the Corporate Secretary and Office of the Corporate Secretary. It offers the challenge of an extremely fast-paced, precision-oriented and team-based environment. It rewards an individual who enjoys Effectively managing multiple, complex and changing priorities Working against tight deadlines Working collaboratively and building relationships Gathering, analyzing and organizing information Planning meetings and events Effectively communicating in writing and on the phone with people at all levels within and outside the company. This position will plan and coordinate logistics for MDLZ’s Board of Directors, Board Committees, and Annual Shareholder Meetings, including travel arrangements, scheduling meetings and social events. This position will interact with MDLZ’s Lead Director, Board of Directors, Chairman and CEO, General Counsel, and other senior management throughout MDLZ. Position Description Provision of site evaluation, contract negotiation, meeting planning, preparation and on-site coordination of service delivery including: Preparation of schedule of events and responsibilities task list related to the coordination of travel with corporate travel and aviation, hotel contract negotiations and meeting room planning, site visits, evaluate AV equipment needs, IS support, menu selection, and reprographics. Leadership of the in-house Board meeting planning team. Evaluation of scheduling alternatives to ensure maximum time effectiveness. Evaluation of alternatives to ensure cost efficiency. Communication in writing and by phone with Directors and/or their assistants to ascertain, confirm and adjust travel needs and logistics. Evaluation of scheduling alternatives to ensure maximum time efficiency. Development and execution of procedures in coordination with the preparation for the Board of Directors, Committee and Annual Shareholders meetings. Coordination and organization of the flow of information and materials among the Directors, Corporate Secretary, General Counsel, CFO, Mondelēz Leadership Team Members, and CEO. Maintenance of monthly attendance records. Create formulas to evaluate YTD percentage of attendance in manner consistent with regulatory and disclosure requirements. Maintenance of master billed expense information and extract pertinent info and provide to Audit as per their schedule. Assembly and analysis of information required for development of Board budget. With Board Legal Assistants, plan, coordinate and execute Board postings Coordinate Travel & expense reporting for all Directors in compliance with corporate policies and SEC disclosure requirements. Assist in investor-related meetings led by the Corporate Secretary as needed Other Corporate Governance and Board related duties as assigned Qualifications Bachelor’s degree preferred Minimum of 5 years of experience in legal or equivalent experience in a law firm or corporation. Experience in scheduling and managing travel and event schedules preferred Microsoft Office Suite, intermediate to expert level required Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to stay consistently abreast and respond to frequent changing priorities/deadlines. Attention to detail a must Self Directed Ability to manage multiple initiatives and set priorities Ability to work in a matrixed environment Ability to quickly assemble and lead effective teams – for short-term projects and long-term responsibilities Travel 5% No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Corporate Sanitation Coordinator
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. Work closely with Plant Sanitation and Quality to develop, implement, and support sanitation and pest control program improvements in US manufacturing locations. This position provides the opportunity to interact with cross-functional (corporate quality, corporate food safety and R&D) teams to ensure company programs and policies are met. This individual should possess project management skills, experience in quality, manufacturing, or R&D, and familiarity with quality/food safety requirements. Success in this role will require teamwork, influencing skills, strong technical skills and knowledge. How You Will Contribute The Corporate Sanitation Coordinator will work closely with Plant Sanitation and Quality to develop, implement, and support sanitation controls program, GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices), pest control program and hygienic equipment and infrastructure design at the assigned manufacturing locations. This position is a regular interface with other members of cross-functional teams to ensure company programs and policies are met or to troubleshoot during unexpected issues that may arise. You will manage the communication of best practices, implementing policies, troubleshooting and problem solving and supporting plant activities on specific projects. There is also a strong link to CI (Continuous Improvement), productivity and efficiency initiatives, as sanitation and quality are integral partners in simplification and improvement programs. Another area of focus is related with people capability as this position plays crucial role to support Learning and Development program (People Technical Capability Building) of the individuals working in the plants related with sanitation programs. Support and actively participate in assigned CoP (Community of practices) within a global scale in order to implement the best practices in US/NA. The ideal candidate will possess project management skills, practical experience in sanitation, quality, food safety, engineering or manufacturing and familiarity with GFSI scheme quality/food safety requirements. Success in this role will require teamwork, influencing skills, problem solving, strong technical skills and knowledge and drive for results. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Excellent communication/influencing skills (presentations, report writing) Excellent Organizational skills including time management and priority setting Proven ability to interact clearly and effectively with cross functional business partners to establish targets plans and maintain timelines to ensure timely and quality execution Ability to apply technical know-how to understand and develop products/processes Able to perform with limited supervision to accomplish objectives Action orientated - Able to anticipate needs and proactively take steps without being asked or told, self-starter Sound background in computer skills, data and presentation abilities. Ability to handle multiple task and prioritize A culture of restless curiosity and a continuous improvement mentality More About This Role Education / Certifications: B.S. degree in Engineering, Food Science, Microbiology, Chemistry or other related Sciences field required Job specific requirements: Minimum 3 years of related experience (Operations, Plant Quality/Sanitation, Corporate Role, or Sanitation auditing) Technical knowledge and practical experience in sanitation and pest control, and the ability to implement at a site level. Technical knowledge and practical experience in sanitation topics such as chemistry of cleaning, sanitation and pest control requirements and ability to implement at a site level. Technical knowledge and practical experience in hygienic infrastructure and equipment design. Sound product safety knowledge (understanding of microbiology) / food technology across product portfolio. Working knowledge of Mondelez QCMS, FSMA and HACCP (or equivalent) standards. Strong auditing, assessment and problem-solving skills Travel requirements: 40% Travel This is an onsite position located in East Hanover, NJ. jobTitle: Data Ingestion Lead
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Possible. You will have the opportunity to make an big impact on our business performance as you support the data strategy and lead the development of custom models/algorithms. Working in close partnership with the business leadership team, you will manage the vision and agenda for business analytics in your area of responsibility. How You Will Contribute You will: Support stakeholders across portfolio using agile ROI/KPI initiatives that will drive improvements Identify and incubate best-in-class external partners to drive delivery on projects Work on development of custom models/algorithms to uncover signals/patterns and trends to drive long-term business performance Support the data strategy in your area of responsibility, which encompasses data collection architecture, data governance, and data reporting infrastructure Build a professional and reliable team Run the business analytics program practice using a methodical approach that conveys to stakeholders what business analytics will deliver` What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in: Ability to influence the business agenda and make recommendations to senior leaders Leadership experience in best-in-class analytics practice roles Leadership experience deploying new analytical approaches in a complex and highly matrixed organization Savvy in usage of analytics techniques to create business impacts Proven people leadership experience More About This Role What you need to know about this position: The Data Ingestion Lead should be able to build and lead a diverse team of individuals with a mix of Big data, Infrastructure, developers and backend engineers. The candidate should be able to operate at the intersection of Infrastructure, Big Data, Storage, & Online Services and explore all aspects of a Data ingestion that collects, stores and serves large amount of information. What extra ingredients you will bring: Strong leadership and management skills Strong communication and interpersonal skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and passion for product development Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and open to working in agile environments with multiple stakeholders Professional attitude and service orientation; team player Ability to translate business needs into potential analytics solution Strong work ethic; ability to work at an abstract level and gain consensus Ability to build a sense of trust & rapport to create a comfortable & effective workplace Education / Certifications: Configure and develop job using Talend and Collibra Program language knowledge like Python, and/or Java Experience working with a variety of source systems (ERP, CRM, custom, on-prem, etc.) and types (databases, files, APIs, SaaS, etc.) Hands-on experience in BI and Data Warehousing, with an emphasis on ETL / data ingestion in a cloud DW / data lake environment Knowledge of distributed computing platforms like Kafka, Spark etc. is a plus. Deep understanding of Data Analytics, Big Data, Storage, Compute & network infrastructures Job specific requirements: Lead multiple data ingestion projects and products to maintain and develop applications for both enterprise releases and smaller maintenance releases Work closely with the business team, 3rd party vendors, and other internal IT teams to deliver projects on time Lead framework-based data ingestion pipelines development to ingest data from a variety of sources into the cloud platform Manage the data ingestion framework to easily extract and load data from various sources into data processing tools, data integration software, and cloud storage Influence and guide strategy, execution and innovation for all aspects of data analytics Experience in taking proactive actions to identify typical problems and issues during the normal course of work and solve them with minimum guidance Define & design large scale distributed system that can be used for interactive as well as batch use cases Develop cross-org partnerships with peer organizations; collaborate and address their data requirements Engage with the open-source community to understand existing work and influence future roadmap Ability to interpret and manipulate large data sets, data storage, ETL and data modelling Proven experience in Data Analysis role with programming skills in SAS and Python Good hands-on Experience with Data warehouse implementation Translate customer and technical requirements into detailed technical plans, architecture, and design Knowledge of CPG customer planning, supply chain planning, delivery and collection processes as well as the data sources utilized across different functions and BUs Evaluate upcoming open-source technologies for distributed computing and integrate such that our platform improves and scales better Interact with infrastructure, business and data teams to produce client requirements for next generation product development No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. jobTitle: DevSecOps Engineer
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours. As a senior DevOps Engineer you will be expected to take a major role in designing, building and supporting our platforms products and capabilities to the enterprise. The role has a deep software engineering focus and is responsible for providing a world class, enterprise ready competitively differentiating DevOps technology capability for Mondelez. You will be expected to be able to contribute along our stack, ranging from our cloud platforms to our on premise monolithic platforms and developer offerings. You'll Have The Following Responsibilities Sets out DevOps Platform strategy and roadmap in line with wider Business & IT strategy to facilitate effective software deployment across the organisation Leads the design and implementation of processes, practices and tools enabling CI/CD, maximising the speed and quality of software delivery and minimising unit costs across digital platforms Manages build automation, release, deployment, and configuration activities of the DevOps platform, setting appropriate milestones & KPIs and working within an Agile framework Define CICD / Automation security requirements (e.g. least privilege principle). Define security testing requirements (such as static/dynamic analysis security testing, vulnerability scanning, penetration testing, etc.). Promote "security-left" (security coding convention, unit tests, static analysers), so that security should be built into the product, rather than applied to the finished product. Manages tool and vendor selection across development automation activities to ensure that tooling is fit for purpose for an enterprise-grade software deployment automation & DevOps platform Owns, leads and drives systems engineering, software delivery automation and CI/CD practices across all digital platforms Follows industry trends and developments to better meet wider business & IT goals and ensure that the DevOps platform ecosystem is at the cutting edge of enterprise-grade software development automation systems Bringing in the right “DevOps” mindset among the teams developing software, which would mean conducting training on tools and processes that makes software development and testing easier. Drive increased maturity on the cloud DevOps capabilities including advanced CI/CD and metrics What extra ingredients you will bring: Good knowledge of DevOps CI/CD workflows, tools and integration points and experience integrating security into SDLC Proven track record of architecting/implementing end to end pipelines that cover the entire SDLC. Experience of having Implemented CI / CD tools such as GitHub, Bamboo, Jenkins, ConnectAll and JFrog including the build of pipelines. Exposure to tools such as Jira, Octopus, Artifactory, Checkmarx, Sonarqube and Confluence. Expertise with programming languages (e.g., Java, PHP, C#, Python), database technologies (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and release & configuration management tools (e.g., Chef, Puppet) Deep understanding of modern DevOps platform technologies incl. infrastructure-as-code and containers Good knowledge/experience of the Application Security space and tools, e.g. OWASP Top 10, SAST, DAST etc. Extensive experience with agile methodologies Extensive experience working in a cloud native environment Understanding of software engineering principals. Knowledge of containerisation tools and approaches would be desirable. Ability to communicate and present technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences Ability to Influence others to achieve buy-in to proposed solutions / recommendations. No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. For office-based, salaried roles at Bakery and Customer Service & Logistics locations, and some remote roles proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required to be eligible for employment. Religious, medical and/or other accommodations as required by law will be considered on a case by case basis. jobTitle: Digital Services Summer Intern (IT)
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter. As an organization we are committed to developing the next generation of Makers and Bakers. Joining us at an early career stage in our fast paced and ever changing environment will enable you to do more, learn more and grow more. You will be encouraged to step outside your comfort zone– you may even surprise yourself! We will ensure you are given the support you need to be at your best and enable you to be yourself and bring passion and personality. Here you can lean in and speak up and bring your own flavor. Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Get ready to Taste The Future. As an organization we are committed to developing the next generation of Makers and Bakers. Join our Taste The Future Program; our fast paced and ever-changing environment will enable you to do more, learn more and grow more. You will be encouraged to step outside your comfort zone– you may even surprise yourself! We will ensure you are given the support you need to be at your best and enable you to be yourself and bring passion and personality. Here you can lean in and speak up and bring your own flavor. Mondelēz Digital Services / Information Technology A summer internship with Mondelēz Digital Services (MDS) / Information Technology (IT) offers tremendous learning opportunities for students pursuing degrees in Computer Science, Information Systems, Software Engineering, Cyber Security, Data Science, Information Technology/Systems, Digital Marketing, eCommerce, Supply Chain Management, and other technology-driven areas of study. Mondelēz International MDS/IT interns quickly learn through and engage in on-the-job training and are afforded the opportunity to work on substantial and meaningful projects that have impactful business outcomes. Interns are provided with a network of mentors, peers, and experts to aid in the development of their technical, business and leadership skills. Interns will also be able to interact with and influence senior leaders across multiple functions and develop relationships, network and interact with other interns both on site and across multiple sites as part of the Global MDS/IT Internship experience. An internship within the MDS/IT organization is generally a 10-week digital assignment providing real-world practice in areas such as Marketing (Consumer), Sales (Customer), Supply Chain, Information Security, Cloud Engineering, Enterprise (Finance, HR, R&D) or Data & Analytics. The position would be in one of the following areas: Consumer Experience – internships consist of working on projects to create a data-centric ecosystem that provides deep consumer understanding, helps accelerate innovation and ensures a seamless experience across all touch points of the consumer journey. These projects work closely with our Marketing teams. Customer Experience – internship projects focus on the delivery of creating omni-channel excellence and digitally enabling route to market (e.g. eCommerce) and stores to drive superior sell-in, execution and productivity. These projects work closely with our Sales and eCommerce teams, Data & Analytics – internship opportunities include working to develop/commercialize an interactive, real-time, intelligent data marketplace enabling end-to-end visibility, actionable insights, and prescriptive analytics for business functions. Information Security – internships focus on protecting the data, systems, resources, and operations of Mondelēz around the world. Projects can include everything from threat assessment to risk management to penetration testing and hardening systems from attack. Cloud Engineering – Intern projects leverage modern software engineering approaches including Infrastructure-as-Code, CI/CD, and DevOps to design and build secure, scalable, and highly available cloud-native infrastructure and application capabilities for Mondelēz around the world. Supply Chain Experience – internships focus on the delivery of digital capabilities to create an Integrated, Reliable, Agile and Adaptive supply chain focused on excellence in execution and competitive advantage. These projects work closely with our Procurement, Planning, Manufacturing, Logistics, and Customer Service functions. Enterprise Experience - internships consist of working on projects relating to the delivery and support of end-user computing technology and other enterprise applications in Finance, HR, and R&D. Each intern is assigned a manager who provides day to day guidance, as well as a mentoring and support network which includes a mentor and a buddy to ensure each intern is set up for success. Qualifications We are looking for qualified individuals with an understanding of information systems, software engineering, disruptive digital technologies, or advanced analytics with a strong understanding of business functions. Leadership, innovative thinking, adaptability, and a strong desire to learn are critical competencies for success. In addition, candidates must have a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. For office-based, salaried roles at Bakery and Customer Service & Logistics locations, and some remote roles proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required to be eligible for employment. Religious, medical and/or other accommodations as required by law will be considered on a case by case basis. You may review the Mondelēz COVID vaccination policy by visiting the US careers website at https://www.mondelezinternational.com/United-States. This COVID-19 vaccine mandate does not apply to several U.S. states that do not permit certain vaccination mandates, including, but not limited to Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, Florida, Indiana, Montana, North Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, and West Virginia. Job Type Intern (Fixed Term) Interns Early Careers

jobTitle: Digital Strategy Innovation Manager, Blockchain
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours. You are part of a team that experiments with cutting-edge technologies, delivering solutions revealed as a result of the testing and learnings, and developing strong partnerships to enable growth through innovation and agile methodologies. How You Will Contribute Innovations is a new space that Mondelez International is building on. Innovations encapsulates projects considered as Learns & Pilots that drive disruptive ideas across the organization. These are projects that will run on Agile methodology and for a duration of typically 8-10 weeks. Based on the learnings of these initiatives a decision would be made to incorporate this as a portfolio project to scale or introduce a new test & learn. The role calls for experimenting cutting edge technologies while at the same time build strong partnership with the North America Business Units involving: Experience of having led a large program. Understanding Digital Transformation. Knowledge of Enterprise Architecture. Ability to stich together strategy / roadmap with the ability to fill in whitespaces, and identify test & learn opportunities. Experience in digital technologies such as Artificial Intelligence /NLP/ML , Metaverse, AR/VR and experience in working with emerging startups and innovation incubator ecosystems. Prior team management experience: a cross functional business and technology experience. Ability to understand a variety of disruptive technology products and services and platforms that will help build the journey form 'Test and learns' to 'Digital Platforms' Demonstrated ability to understand the Industry trends and help build an organization digital strategy / Platform / Roadmap. Understanding of Enterprise Architectural construct. C Suite Engagement and ability to represent MDLZ in global forums; proven skills of learning on the fly & agility THE KEY RESPONSIBILITES FOR THE ROLE: Expected to design the Strategy, develop the roadmap and lead key Programs identified under Innovation and Digital Pillars. E.g. The leader will help bring the outside in view of building digital journey for an experience tower and also be the POC for the region across all experience towers. e.g. US Digital, Latin America Digital and Customer. The BU / Market Digitalization will cut across towers and there also support in building the Customer / Consumer / Supply Chain Digital Roadmaps Innovation Hub is an evolving pillar within Mondelez MDS. Innovations encapsulates three different service lines: Initiatives considered as 'test & learn' that drive disruptive ideas across Experience Towers. These initiatives run on Agile methodology and for a duration of typically 8-12 weeks. Based on the learnings a decision could be made to convert these initiatives to a portfolio project that can provide Mondelez great competitive advantage and business benefit. The role impacts the entire innovation agenda of tower/region/BU's, ranging in billions of revenue, 1000's of stakeholders, and 100's of customers. Rapid application development - expand the concept of citizen development and enable functional teams to digitize processes using low code-no code technologies. The role calls for strong partnership with senior business function leads (in many cases MLT, MLT+1) and external parties (Vendors / Incubators) involving: Accountability of bringing outside in thinking and ideas for the allocated experience tower e.g. Customer / Consumer / Supply / Enterprise that will help leap frog the Digital Journey Strong C suit Stakeholder Management for representing MDLZ at various Global Incubator forums setting collaborations / partnerships for development of Leap frog Ideas Collaborate and partner with Snack Futures (recommending M&A opportunities) other Innovation Leads to lead and drive resolution of roadblocks for the allocated region e.g. AMEA, MEU, NALA, and represent innovation team for respective region Coaching and direct Team Members to effectively delivery their respective initiatives THE KEY EXPERIENCE FOR THE ROLE: 10+ years’ experience leveraging emerging tech to deliver large scale Digital transformations and solve complex business problems Masters or Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Computer Science Ability to understand a variety of disruptive technology products and services that will guide Supply Chain, Sales and Marketing (digital & eCom) Passionate about innovations, digital technologies and possess technical acumen to evaluate new opportunities with internal and external partners. 3+ years’ of demonstrated capability working with Distributed Ledger Technology 3+ years’ foundational knowledge of enterprise value, processes, tools, or technologies related to the Multi Party Systems (Distributed Database, Distributed Ledger, Tokenization & Confidential compute) Familiarity with WEB3, permissioned and permission less systems with an understanding of Layer 1, Layer 2 and Layer 3 solutions in the CPG Industry Experience with designing and developing APIs for blockchain integration Experience with designing and developing the frontend and backend of decentralized applications Experience with designing, developing, and implementing Smart Contracts Experience in digital technologies such as Artificial Intelligence /NLP/ML , Metaverse, AR/VR and experience in working with emerging startups and innovation incubator ecosystems. Experience with one or more cloud platforms, including AWS, GCP, or Azure Proven track record of learning new skills proactively and applied it to business opportunities Understand the impact of data and digital technologies in the context of business Experience in a major CPG or parallel industry #dice No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. jobTitle: Director, Executive Compensation
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Possible. Our employees are key ingredients to our success, and reporting to the Global Head of Executive Compensation, the Director of Executive Compensation is a key member of the Rewards Leadership Team. This role will be responsible for the design, development, communication, and implementation of Executive Compensation Programs. They will effectively work with and influence senior leadership and work collaboratively with HR, Talent Acquisition and Business Leaders across the company to play a critical role in developing the future direction of global compensation programs. Responsibilities: Design Executive Compensation and Management Equity programs to ensure individual rewards are differentiated by business and individual performance to support the company’s strategies. Collaborate on the development of agenda topics and material development for the People and Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors. Lead with Legal and Finance, the annual development of the Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) and corresponding executive compensation tables in the Company’s proxy statement. Manage the annual cycle of assessing executive compensation competitiveness. Oversee the development and approval of equity programs. Ensure that program objectives are effectively communicated globally and understood throughout the organization. Closely collaborate with internal resources on the administration and annual enrollment cycles for the executive nonqualified deferred compensation plan and the director’s deferral plan. Closely collaborate with various internal groups - Legal, Tax, internal Communications, Public Relations, and others as needed on a variety of issues pertaining to equity compensation. Work closely with Executive Talent Acquisition to build an understanding of executive compensation programs, marketing content for candidates; provide guidance in creating and initiating offers. Create internal learning modules and communications in partnership with HR Business Partners to improve design and understanding of executive compensation programs. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in: Deep knowledge and awareness of external trends and can integrate this with business strategy to create actionable insights Strong ability to lead and apply organizational and change theories; ability to influence change at all levels within an organization Demonstrate strong interpersonal and listening skills and maintain an active network inside/outside the organization Proven ability dealing with all levels of management and the sensitivity of different cultures, developing formal and information relationships within the organization to assist in goal achievement Ability to speak concisely and to adapt messages to a range of audiences to inspire action and lead cross-functional to achieve results without direct authority Broad business acumen and systems thinking, continuous learning approach to the business and strong curiosity to understand others' contexts High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results-orientation Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree is required, Master’s degree preferred 12 or more years of Human Resources experience with 7 or more of those years being Compensation experience to include Design, Development, and Implementation of Executive, Equity and Incentive programs Previous experience in preparing materials for the Compensation Committee of a Board of Directors and external reporting Experience working for a global multi-national company, where influence and relationship building skills are essential Strong voice internally and externally; ability to influence across the organization, including senior leadership Well-honed problem solving and decision-making skills, is agile and adaptable, and can effectively manage change Outstanding communication skills, ability to coordinate and supervise the work of multiple workstreams running in parallel Strong English communication and inter-personal skills; ability to work effectively with global teams and stakeholders Within Country Relocation support available and for candidates voluntarily moving internationally some minimal support is offered through our Volunteer International Transfer Policy Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. For office-based, salaried roles at Bakery and Customer Service & Logistics locations, and some remote roles proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required to be eligible for employment. Religious, medical and/or other accommodations as required by law will be considered on a case by case basis. jobTitle: Director, Functional Optimization Finance
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours. You provide software and applications expertise, and be responsible for implementation of the solutions. Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours. You provide software and applications expertise, and be responsible for implementation of the solutions. How You Will Contribute You will oversee the planning and execution of software and applications. To do so, you will manage an internal team and partner with external suppliers and use your deep technical and market knowledge and thorough understanding of our business goals find and deploy the right software and application solutions for the future. You will support programs to implement regional and global software and application strategies, offer input to financial planning and controls for software and applications on a regional and global level, collaborate with management and follow-up on requisitions, purchase orders, invoices, and payments, explores opportunities to leverage scale and drive savings, and ensure that support service level objectives and key performance indicators are accomplished. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in : Managing staff and line responsibilities Managing large-scale software and application services Service delivery, support and excellence Program/Project management with experience managing multiple projects for budgets, resources, schedules and quality General technical background Understanding of integration and how different applications talk to each other Process and service orientation CPG Business processes experience is a plus Additional Job Description 8-12 years of experience in large SAP ERP implementations across all SAP modules 5+ years direct management/supervisory experience required on 4 or more SAP business processes such as RTR (FI), OTC, PTP, HTR, MTD/PTD, EWM, IBP/APO/DP, CRM, etc. Solid experience working with business process leads on streamlining functional requirements to propose standard SAP solutions Experience managing functional teams on at least 4 full-cycle SAP implementations two of which is S/4HANA Significant experience on collecting and optimizing abstract business requirements and translating them into WRICEF objects for development Experience with BPO and RPA Outstanding communication skills, ability to coordinate and supervise the work of multiple workstreams running in parallel Strong communication and inter-personal skills; ability to work effectively with global teams Strong analytical and problem-solving skills - communicate in a clear and succinct manner and effectively evaluate information / data to make decisions, anticipate obstacles and develops plans to resolve, creates actionable strategies and operational plans Good understanding of business processes, coupled with the ability to effectively partner with functional managers to manage portfolio What you need to know about this position: SAP COE is engaged in multiple parallel projects and initiatives globally from current SAP Optimization and Continuous Improvement, to new solutions implementation, M&A’s, On premise and Cloud solutions, with complex integrations; and an aggressive agenda. What extra ingredients you will bring: Experience in new solutions, and in digital transformation, Strong SAP background and leadership Education / Certifications: SAP latest solutions and technologies; AGILE; ITIL; PM, other relevant certifications Job specific requirements: Fluent and Advanced interaction in English is a must: conversational, and effective communication Travel requirements: 30 – 60% No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. ability to work effectively with global teams Strong analytical and problem-solving skills - communicate in a clear and succinct manner and effectively evaluate information / data to make decisions, anticipate obstacles and develops plans to resolve, creates actionable strategies and operational plans Good understanding of business processes, coupled with the ability to effectively partner with functional managers to manage portfolio What you need to know about this position: SAP COE is engaged in multiple parallel projects and initiatives globally from current SAP Optimization and Continuous Improvement, to new solutions implementation, M&A’s, On premise and Cloud solutions, with complex integrations; and an aggressive agenda. jobTitle: Director of US Media
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. Title: Director of US Media / Consumer Experience Location: US / East Hanover, NJ At Mondelēz International, we empower people to snack right. Think about it. All around the world, there’s a universal cultural tension: the lines between meals and snacks are blurring. From on-the-go “second breakfast” needs to a mindful moment of indulgence in the evening, our brands and products have opportunities to satisfy consumers throughout the day. So, there’s an increasing snacking need – but consumers don’t want to have to choose between snacking and eating right. Insert Mondelēz International ... and our Purpose to empower people to snack right. Consumers decide what and how they want to eat. We simply obsess over their interests and innovate to make sure they continue to reach for the goodness of our snacks when they want a delicious, wholesome, nutritious, or indulgent bite made from ingredients and with packaging they can feel good about. Our purpose drives each decision we make. It is the lens through which we see the world. It inspires us to give our best each day. And it gives our work deeper meaning. We empower people to snack right. The US Media Lead will provide thought leadership and expertise on how media fits within a connected marketing world and collaborate with brand, technology, creative and data & analytics teams to bring our marketing plans and purpose to life. Purpose of Role In Marketing & Media, you’ll be the one who first captures our consumers’ imaginations, giving them a tantalizing taste of our brands. The role of Director of US Media is to lead the US media strategy and maximize the financial return of all media investments across our portfolio of brands. The US Media lead position is based in East Hanover, NJ and reports to the Director of Global Media Strategy and Americas Operations and dotted line to the US Growth Lead. The US Consumer Experience (Director of US Media) position leads the development and implementation of consumer first communication strategies across paid, owned content and platforms across MDLZ brands in collaboration with local/global MDLZ teams and agency partners - driving innovative and effective experiences. The individual must be a capable manager who is confident and experienced in leading agencies and internal resources to deliverable industry-leading level of quality. They are expected to be a thought leader, capable of optimizing current efforts and bringing new insights through a mixture of innovation and broad, creative thinking. Functional competencies required: Deep Media Planning & Investment Expertise. Provide strategic thought leadership and deep technical expertise on how media fits within a connected marketing world and collaborate with brand, technology, creative and data & analytics teams to ensure that media plans are strategically aligned. Strong competency in modern media approaches, investment and strategy. Brand Strategy, Positioning & Equity Competency. Exemplify Consumer Experience Design and Activation, bringing brand strategy and positioning to life throughout all communications planning including traditional, paid digital/social, owned and earned channels. Digital Native. Fluent and demonstrated capability to advance a digital agenda, for paid, owned and earned media, while building organizational competency. Marketing Effectiveness & Efficiency. Strong understanding of ROI to ensure we optimize cost, while accelerating effectiveness. Strong Team Leader with the ability to navigate across various levels within organization and with external partners. Balance of strategic & strong analytical thinking, excellent presentation skills, and experience managing and coaching direct reports in a rapid growth environment. Ensure agency relationships continue to be strengthened by quality of deliverables and brand satisfaction. Qualifications and Experiences: BA (Marketing or Business Administration) required; MBA preferred 12+ years’ experience 5+ year of leading cross-media strategy, investment and implementation (client or agency) rooted in deep understanding of consumer behaviors, data and media partner capabilities Problem solver with exceptional ability to digest new information, master new techniques and translate knowledge to others in highly engaged environment Proficiency in influencing teams and partners with indirect reporting lines Experience managing large agency teams / resources either within a client marketing organization or at an agency Ability to prioritize and organize issues/projects for self, internal team and external agency partners Excellent written and verbal communication skills Country to country Relocation support available through our Global Mobility Policies Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint.
