jobTitle: Director, Seasonals
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. Director, Seasonals Confections and Biscuits East Hanover, NJ Seasonals is a dynamic, high-growth part of our US business. We are looking for an experienced leader to propel the business into the next phase of growth. This is a highly incremental, share-driving portion of our Candy business, and an emerging growth driver for our Biscuits business. Seasonals spans across all major seasons, including Festive, Halloween, Valentine’s Day, Easter, and Summer. The Seasonals Director will develop and implement Mondelēz’s long-term Seasonals strategy and business plan across brands including Sour Patch Kids, Toblerone and Oreo. In addition, this individual will lead the Seasonals Marketing team to deliver in-year financial and market share objectives and develop a long-term innovation pipeline to fuel the portfolio, while ensuring efficient commercial execution and strong Sales relationships. Key Responsibilities Responsible for the Seasonal business across categories: P&L, strategy, annual plan execution, AC, innovation pipeline & Strategic Growth Plan (SP) Be a leader and partner with Sales and cross-functionally to develop the Seasonal strategy Responsible for the following Seasons: Valentine’s, Easter, Summer, Halloween and Holiday across Candy, Chocolate and Cookie categories. Responsible for equity, innovation, commercialization, repeats & waste management. jobTitle: Director & Sr Counsel, ESG & M&A
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter. Mondelez International is seeking a Director, ESG and M&A. ESG and M&A are key strategic priorities for the company. Based in Chicago, IL, this role will report to the Vice President and Chief Counsel, M&A and will have two core responsibilities: (1) day-to-day accountability for legal guidance and support of global corporate ESG and Sustainability & Impact Team matters, and (2) act as a member of the 6-person M&A legal team responsible for the execution of M&A transactions globally. The role is expected to be approximately 66% ESG and 34% M&A. Key Responsibilities ESG: Act as global legal partner for Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) (including Sustainability) providing legal guidance and support for enterprise wide ESG and Sustainability and Impact Team matters, including processes for legal review and approval, legal claims/positions, ESG litigation support, and leadership of the ESG Global Community of Practice. Responsibilities will include: Provide legal advice to the Sustainability & Impact Team; act as legal integrator/guide for ESG-related claim substantiation and positions globally, including smart record creation and active knowledge management; develop and deploy toolkits/matrices/processes for ESG-related claim substantiation; act as enterprise-wide resource on ESG legal-related matters. Lead the ESG global Community of Practice, a core group of global/BU lawyers that is responsible for: anticipating and advising on multidisciplinary ESG-related issues in an aligned, coordinated manner to bring best-in-class thinking to these issues; developing, sharing and implementing best practices on ESG matters for the business; mapping processes for legal review and approval of non-financial disclosures to support the Vice President, Sustainable Packaging, ESG Reporting & Engagement and defining and clarifying legal roles and processes; and engaging the broader organization on ESG education and learning; collaborating with colleagues to build and enhance ESG capabilities. Partner with the Chief Counsel, Litigation NA to review and manage work on ESG claims and facilitate enterprise-wide coordination with litigation specialists and outside counsel. Support Executive Vice President and General Counsel on ESG matters for the Management Leadership Team and Board of Directors. M&A: Act as a member of the legal M&A team providing legal counsel to Mondelēz and its subsidiaries related to merger, acquisition, divestiture and joint venture (“M&A”) transactions globally. The M&A aspect of this role requires substantial M&A legal experience across public, private and cross-border transactions and a deep expertise in M&A, corporate and related transactional law. Under the supervision of the VP and Chief Counsel, M&A, the position will lead complex legal work for different aspects of an M&A transaction life cycle, from early-stage discussions to post-completion matters. Daily assignments may include building and leading due diligence teams, drafting and negotiating preliminary, definitive and ancillary transaction agreements, handling pre-closing deliverables, supervising and successfully completing closings and supporting integration efforts. Required Experience 7+ years’ experience in a large, international law firm or multi-national corporate in-house legal department. JD from an accredited law school and license to practice law in 1 US jurisdiction; ability to be licensed in IL. Excellent management skills and business judgment with a capacity to make decisions and give advice in a risk-calibrated manner, demonstrating an understanding of overall business objectives and the risks/rewards of each situation. Experience providing advice and support to internal stakeholders to develop, establish and improve internal processes. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail; ability to work with others and manage multiple time sensitive matters in a demanding, fast-paced and matrixed environment. Strong research and writing skills, and a demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with a non-legal audience, are required. Comfortable with ambiguity and uncertainty; the ability to adapt nimbly and lead others through complex situations. High degree of initiative, self‐direction, and ability to work independently and within a team. Ability to oversee and effectively manage outside counsel and internal stakeholders. ESG Experience with environmental, social and/or governance matters, including sustainability and ingredients, climate, packaging and social issues. Litigation and/or litigation risk management experience preferred. M&A Cross border transactions. Negotiating and managing significant M&A transactions. Experience with one or more of the following preferred: (i) representing strategic and private equity buyers and sellers; (ii) Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) / Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) industry; (iii) global M&A competition analysis and/or regulatory filings; and (iv) experience working with key internal functions such as tax, accounting, finance, and treasury. Within Country Relocation support available and for candidates voluntarily moving internationally some minimal support is offered through our Volunteer International Transfer Policy Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Driver CDL
jobDescription: Job Description Do you want to Drive a Sweet Career? Come join us at Mondelēz International and transport brands like Oreo, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit, Wheat Thins, Sour Patch, Swedish Fish, Belvita and so many more. Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Possible. You will ensure that our products are delivered safely and on time. You will stock your truck with our products, drive to stores and warehouses and unload at locations where needed and be back home in the evening. How You Will Contribute You will: Ensure compliance with procedures and regular safety checks of your equipment (tractor, trailer, pallet jack, etc.) to guarantee safety at all times. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Clean CDL-Class A license. At least one year of proven safe driving experience and no serious driving convictions. If more than one-year experience, the DOT requirement is to check the last 3 years. Basic understanding of temperature-controlled food transportation. Able to use a smart phone or tablet and electronic logging device (ELD) for logging positions and driving times. Flexibility toward daily changing routes and working times A great customer-oriented attitude. General understanding of vehicle mechanics to communicate problems in case of breakdowns and to perform basic repairs yourself Job specific requirements: Valid CDL-Class A license. FMCSA’s Clearinghouse Registration. If you are not registered yet, here is the link to get started: FMSCA You must successfully pass our drug test, MVR, and background check. jobTitle: DSD Delivery Logistics Coordinator
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Possible. The DSD Delivery Logistics Coordinator, will execute branch operations in term of service, cost, health and safety, quality, food defense, sustainability, legal requirements and policies compliance. You will also work collaboratively with key internal and external (third-party logistics vendors) business partners to ensure effective management, timely solutions, and execution. You will also be responsible for activities such as inventory management (iDoc management, stock reconciliation), interfaces monitoring, track and trace, claims management, invoice management, compliance execution (HSE, quality, risk management), tenders support, third-party performance management, pallets management. How You Will Contribute You will: 1. Compliance & Controls adherence in support of Delivery pillar, monitoring and supporting applications and reporting data tied to driver performance. Fleet Safety: Assist branches managing unassigned miles and any other Telogis needs. Monitor DQ/MVR process, including random drug test People: Assist branches with the on-boarding and training process of new hires/new in roles, particularly around set up and access to applications. Assist branches managing any union health and welfare requirements Customer focus: Provide assistance to the RDCL to support branch operations & service analytics/reporting capabilities. Delivery Ops: Monitor Branch Mobile Link, Edge, POD, Manifest performance by Driver and assist branch with managing the Route Planner and Edge systems, as needed. Review Service and Productivity Reports and assist branch manage performance. Complete Delivery Time Comparison and Time Window Analysis semi-annual by Branch and help address changes throughout the year, include Holiday schedules in SAP and communications to retail Delivery Assets: Produce Warehouse Assembler performance reporting. Monitor Cart/Pallet reporting in Edge and assist branch with CHEP pallet management. Manage new vendor creation process for branches KPIs: DQ/MVR performance (DOT regs), onboarding/training new hires & application set up/access, Route Compliance, planned routes vs. act, Out of Route miles, idle time/fuel usage. No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. jobTitle: Electrician (Hourly Rate $32.87)
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. You independently operate and maintain at least one process, equipment or systems following autonomous maintenance (AM) standards and use your technical skills to improve line and/or system performance to meet business needs. How You Will Contribute You are a key ingredient in changing how the world snacks. With coaching, you will operate and maintain equipment to deliver on our safety, quality, cost, delivery, sustainability and morale targets. You will use execute all standard work processes on your equipment using AM (autonomous maintenance) and PM (progressive maintenance) standards and ensure that safety processes are observed, and that quality assurance activities are performed. You will understand the losses in their area and equipment and report them. Diagnose and repair production equipment in an industrial manufacturing environment Repair, maintain, and upgrade electrical equipment Read and understand wiring schematics Perform PLC troubleshooting and programming Experience using test equipment to troubleshoot electrical issues (Multimeter, Megger, thermography, etc.) Knowledge of industrial 3 phase equipment, controls, VFD drives, Be familiar with control devices (e.g. Allen Bradley, ABB, and Foxboro) Must be able to troubleshoot and repair up to 480V equipment Perform calibration of 4-20 MA instruments and other low voltage systems. Ensures conformance with all Safety, GMP’s, health code regulations, NEC, NFPA standards and Food Safety Policies What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in: Operating machines with coaching Safety and quality standards for operating machines Reading and writing, and fluently conversant in the language of communication as appropriate to the site Collaborating well in a diverse work environment More About This Role Education / Certifications: High School Diploma - Required Additional Job Requirements At least 2 years of manufacturing experience Ability to work any shift, weekends, and holidays as required Ability to work well in a team-based environment with limited supervision Able to learn and apply Continuous Improvement tools (IL6S) - Preferred Capable of working effectively as part of a High-Performance Team Ability to problem solve and help with practical solution The following physical demands are examples of duties that may be performed: Climb steps Lift 50 pounds and maintain balance Ability to perform duties in extreme varying temperatures Crawl over, under, and into equipment as necessary to perform job duties Work from ladders and lifts Work schedule: Must be flexible to work any shift Benefits: 100% covered, no employee contribution Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. jobTitle: Electrician Journeyman. Pay Rate $28.93 Hourly +$3,500 Sign on Bonus
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International/Nabisco? We are the creators of Oreo, Ritz Crackers, Triscuit, Sour Patch and Swedish Fish to name a few. Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. As expert you will bring a deep technical mastery of the process and equipment. That expertise allows you to lead the planning, process development and implementation of Planned Maintenance Elements in a Continuous Improvement manufacturing environment. You will manage this through teams consisting of various technical and non-technical personnel, key support contractors and operations personnel. How You Will Contribute You will: Partner & Enable the line leader(s) to deliver the SQCDSM targets-Safety, Quality, Cost, Delivery, Sustainability & Morale for the lines, to ensure Process stability; Participates in the DMS- Daily Management systems meetings at the shift and line level Own the technology and process and centerline settings for the equipment and process and have deep technical mastery of the process and equipment; Owns the PM-Progressive maintenance systems and work processes and the PM-Progressive Maintenance Key Performance Indicators for the line/s along with Centerline Management systems; owns the R&M-Repairs & Maintenance budget of the line Develop, own and execute the line/s preventive and time-based maintenance systems and plans and build capability of the team to execute themselves; Build (spends at least 50% of time) technical and maintenance skills of the technicians working in the shifts, so that they are able to operate and maintain their equipment themselves; be part of the PM Pillar, own all PM systems and work process at the line level and lead some of them at the department level Partner with the Asset and Reliability team for system improvement and execution of special maintenance tasks; be responsible for Change Management on the line/s, localization of spares and proper break-down analysis and R&M cost reduction for the line/s; Represents the department/line/s as the site technology owner in the regional and global technology forums Assist in VSU for the new initiatives and enable the VSU team; Help the line leader in internal and external benchmarking and reapplication; be the subject matter expert on one of the component categories and be a trainer of PM related subjects for the plant What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Advanced knowledge (including AM-Autonomous Maintenance Step 4 systems & Progressive Maintenance Step 3) & skill to maintain the dedicated equipment(s)at basic conditions independently, including the execution of AM & PM (BD-Breakdown maintenance, planned maintenance) standards on dedicated equipment(s) and TPM - Phase 3 & 4 tools problem solving tools The capability to lead a Role for the Line. Qualify and coach the next level SWP owners and drive the common opportunity areas across the line in PDCA-Plan Do Check Adjust approach The capability to work as the Line Leader, developing and aligning goal/master plan for the line, deploying and managing IDP for the members, coaching team members on their performance management and career development Essential Functions More about this role Tests, installs, and repairs plant equipment and machinery. Performs preventive maintenance and safety inspections on the equipment and machinery. Performs the required electrical maintenance repair and project installation work including but not limited to measuring, cutting, threading, bending, and installation of electrical conduit. Also, the proper application and use of appropriate conduit clamps, hangers, straps, bushings, hubs and conduit fittings. Proper application (identification and wire sizing), installation (wire pulling & termination), and use of electrical conductors as applied to required field requirements (voltages & current loads per application according to NEC). Understanding of the functioning and installation of power, control, communications circuits and motor control. Troubleshooting and repair of general electrical problems in plant electrical equipment. Proper application (identification and wire sizing), installation (wire pulling & termination), and use of electrical conductors as applied to required field requirements (voltages & current loads per application according to NEC). Understanding of the functioning and installation of power, control, and communications circuits. Repair to plant emergency lighting, area lighting fixtures, lighted exist signs, and safety signs. Documents work performed and communicates work activities to appropriate personnel. Reads, studies and reviews manuals, schematics and drawings and relevant literature to stay current on new equipment and the updating of existing equipment. Provides on-call emergency repair service for all areas of the mill. Takes work assignments from the Maintenance Reliability Planner. Consults with immediate supervisor concerning issues, unusual problems or developments and clarification on direction and scope of efforts. Follows all applicable policies and procedures, including Safety, Quality and GMP’s. Education / Certifications: High school diploma or GED required At least 5 years of industrial maintenance work experience. Candidates must have documented electrical certification. Ability to work any shift, weekends, & overtime to support business needs, sometimes on short notice. This position requires skills building in the Mechanical trades toward certificate. Machines/equipment Uses test instruments, programming devices, personal computers, measuring devices, hand tools, power tools. Proper use of multimeter for circuit testing reading volt, ohm, amp, and continuity as well as megger(megohmmeter) test instruments and motor MCE. Trouble shooting, adjustments, repairs on variable speed motor controllers. PLC trouble shooting, limited PLC programming. Working conditions Moderate exposure to dusty and dirty work conditions and seasonal weather extremes (work is both inside and outside). Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs. Works from ladders and elevated platforms. Climb steps, crawl over, under and into equipment as necessary to perform job duties. Pay rate: $28.93 USD Hourly. $0.25 hourly shift differential Schedule: From Monday to Friday. 2nd shift 3pm-11pm. Weekend work as assigned Benefits: Primary Care Physician Office Visits Specialist Physician Office Visits Inpatient Hospital Outpatient Surgical Facility Outpatient Physical/Occupational/Speech Therapy Emergency Room Facility Urgent Care Facility Ambulance service Skilled Nursing Facility Days Mental Illness/Substance Abuse support Infertility assistance Contraception Services Preventive Health Services Habilitative Services Paid time off Pension 401K Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. Proper application (identification and wire sizing), installation (wire pulling & termination), and use of electrical conductors as applied to required field requirements (voltages & current loads per application according to NEC). Understanding of the functioning and installation of power, control, communications circuits and motor control. Troubleshooting and repair of general electrical problems in plant electrical equipment. Proper application (identification and wire sizing), installation (wire pulling & termination), and use of electrical conductors as applied to required field requirements (voltages & current loads per application according to NEC). Understanding of the functioning and installation of power, control, and communications circuits. Repair to plant emergency lighting, area lighting fixtures, lighted exist signs, and safety signs. Documents work performed and communicates work activities to appropriate personnel. Reads, studies and reviews manuals, schematics and drawings and relevant literature to stay current on new equipment and the updating of existing equipment. Provides on-call emergency repair service for all areas of the mill. Takes work assignments from the Maintenance Reliability Planner. Consults with immediate supervisor concerning issues, unusual problems or developments and clarification on direction and scope of efforts. Follows all applicable policies and procedures, including Safety, Quality and GMP’s. Education / Certifications: High school diploma or GED required At least 5 years of industrial maintenance work experience. Candidates must have documented electrical certification. Ability to work any shift, weekends, & overtime to support business needs, sometimes on short notice. This position requires skills building in the Mechanical trades toward certificate. Machines/equipment Uses test instruments, programming devices, personal computers, measuring devices, hand tools, power tools. Proper use of multimeter for circuit testing reading volt, ohm, amp, and continuity as well as megger(megohmmeter) test instruments and motor MCE. Trouble shooting, adjustments, repairs on variable speed motor controllers. PLC trouble shooting, limited PLC programming. Working conditions Moderate exposure to dusty and dirty work conditions and seasonal weather extremes (work is both inside and outside). Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs. Works from ladders and elevated platforms. Climb steps, crawl over, under and into equipment as necessary to perform job duties. Pay rate: $28.93 USD Hourly. $0.25 hourly shift differential Schedule: From Monday to Friday. 2nd shift 3pm-11pm. Weekend work as assigned Benefits: Primary Care Physician Office Visits Specialist Physician Office Visits Inpatient Hospital Outpatient Surgical Facility Outpatient Physical/Occupational/Speech Therapy Emergency Room Facility Urgent Care Facility Ambulance service Skilled Nursing Facility Days Mental Illness/Substance Abuse support Infertility assistance Contraception Services Preventive Health Services Habilitative Services Paid time off Pension 401K Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Electrician Journeyman. Pay Rate: $28.93 Hourly +$3,500 Sign on Bonus
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International/Nabisco? We are the creators of Oreo, Ritz Crackers, Triscuit, Sour Patch and Swedish Fish to name a few. Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. As expert you will bring a deep technical mastery of the process and equipment. That expertise allows you to lead the planning, process development and implementation of Planned Maintenance Elements in a Continuous Improvement manufacturing environment. You will manage this through teams consisting of various technical and non-technical personnel, key support contractors and operations personnel. How You Will Contribute You will: Partner & Enable the line leader(s) to deliver the SQCDSM targets-Safety, Quality, Cost, Delivery, Sustainability & Morale for the lines, to ensure Process stability; Participates in the DMS- Daily Management systems meetings at the shift and line level Own the technology and process and centerline settings for the equipment and process and have deep technical mastery of the process and equipment; Owns the PM-Progressive maintenance systems and work processes and the PM-Progressive Maintenance Key Performance Indicators for the line/s along with Centerline Management systems; owns the R&M-Repairs & Maintenance budget of the line Develop, own and execute the line/s preventive and time-based maintenance systems and plans and build capability of the team to execute themselves; Build (spends at least 50% of time) technical and maintenance skills of the technicians working in the shifts, so that they are able to operate and maintain their equipment themselves; be part of the PM Pillar, own all PM systems and work process at the line level and lead some of them at the department level Partner with the Asset and Reliability team for system improvement and execution of special maintenance tasks; be responsible for Change Management on the line/s, localization of spares and proper break-down analysis and R&M cost reduction for the line/s; Represents the department/line/s as the site technology owner in the regional and global technology forums Assist in VSU for the new initiatives and enable the VSU team; Help the line leader in internal and external benchmarking and reapplication; be the subject matter expert on one of the component categories and be a trainer of PM related subjects for the plant What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Advanced knowledge (including AM-Autonomous Maintenance Step 4 systems & Progressive Maintenance Step 3) & skill to maintain the dedicated equipment(s)at basic conditions independently, including the execution of AM & PM (BD-Breakdown maintenance, planned maintenance) standards on dedicated equipment(s) and TPM - Phase 3 & 4 tools problem solving tools The capability to lead a Role for the Line. jobTitle: Electronic Specialist
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. You independently operate and maintain at least one process, equipment or systems following autonomous maintenance (AM) standards and use your technical skills to improve line and/or system performance to meet business needs. How You Will Contribute You are a key ingredient in changing how the world snacks. With coaching, you will operate and maintain equipment to deliver on our safety, quality, cost, delivery, sustainability and morale targets. You will use execute all standard work processes on your equipment using AM (autonomous maintenance) and PM (progressive maintenance) standards and ensure that safety processes are observed, and that quality assurance activities are performed. You will understand the losses in their area and equipment and report them. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in: Operating machines with coaching Safety and quality standards for operating machines Reading and writing, and fluently conversant in the language of communication as appropriate to the site Collaborating well in a diverse work environment More About This Role Education / Certifications: High School Diploma or GED required Technical degree or certificate in electrical / electronics field (plus) Job specific requirements: Demonstrated self-motivation. Ability to troubleshoot electrical equipment. Minimum 5yrs of industrial experience / electronics industry. Must be able to work overtime and flex between shifts as required. Must be able to work from heights using fall protection and maintaining elevated lift, as well as maintaining a good safety and compliance record. Ability to work in a pay for performance environment where your increasing skills allow you to achieve above standard pay. Demonstrated ability to problem-solve, to think and act innovatively. Work schedule: Mon - Thur (10hrs) Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. For office-based, salaried roles at Bakery and Customer Service & Logistics locations, and some remote roles proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required to be eligible for employment. Religious, medical and/or other accommodations as required by law will be considered on a case by case basis. You may review the Mondelēz COVID vaccination policy by visiting the US careers website at https://www.mondelezinternational.com/United-States. This COVID-19 vaccine mandate does not apply to several U.S. states that do not permit certain vaccination mandates, including, but not limited to Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, Florida, Indiana, Montana, North Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, and West Virginia. Job Type Regular Manufacturing core Manufacturing

jobTitle: Enterprise DevOps Practitioner / SAFe Agile Coach
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours. About This Role In this job, you’ll be leading planning, implementing, and embedding the Enterprise Agile & DevSecOps practices across Mondelez. You’ll ensure the entire Mondelez Digital Services teams are aligned to the Right Sized IT Delivery model that embraces best practices of Agile@Scale to drive high quality, frequent delivery of business outcomes at pace in collaboration with the wider Mondelez Digital Services teams, so that together we can deliver Enterprise Agility and accelerate business value. You’ll bring to bear your extensive experience advising organizations, leading by example and challenging the status quo to promote an environment and culture of continuous improvement, experimentation, and innovation. You’ll also be accountable for the team who provides training to support the implementation of the operating model; managing supporting tooling and optimising how it’s used and lead on the change management and communications to embed the change and grow an engaging people centric culture. You'll Have The Following Responsibilities Act as a trusted advisor to organizations when guiding them through their Lean/Agile transformation, utilizing best practices on Organizational design, Customer Focus, Lean Portfolio Management, Team and Technical Agility and Leadership Agility. Work with senior leaders to define strategies and roadmaps for transitioning to Lean/Agile & DevSecOps practices. Mentor and pair with change agents within Mondelez on becoming true Lean/Agile champions and creating a sustaining Agile capabilities. Drives continuous improvement and culture of high performance through strategic programs, advocating for and effecting behavioural and process change across the organisation by influencing decision makers and inspiring and motivating others to adopt new ways of working. Enhance core structures, governance, and ways of working from an end-to-end perspective working across squads, tribes, Enterprise, and Digital leadership whilst not disrupting in flight delivery programs. Drive the visibility of delivery and status of delivery across the squads, Tribes, and leadership, including business value orientated progress, status of major release and key change against commitments including establishing forecast completion dates. Embed and drive data-driven delivery, including the identification of key metrics. Improve the coordination across Tribes to deliver large scale technology development through technical releases to support Business Goals. Work with the Portfolio Planning & Demand Managers and Tribe Agile Delivery Managers (RTE) identifying bottlenecks and reducing lead time from Idea to launch. Support the Agile Delivery Managers (RTEs) and Agile coaches to implement cross tribe quarterly Program Increment planning events, defining enhancements for efficiency and increased delivery confidence. Optimise flow of value through the squads; define and implement data analytics (i.e. Cycle Time metrics) for quantification, assessing and driving improvements to DevOps and release and CI/CD pipelines. Coach Tribe leads on Agile delivery good practices; leading regular cross Tribe retrospective and continuous improvement activities to create high performing Tribes focused on customer centricity and value. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in : End-to-end business and functional knowledge Operations (infrastructure and technical aspects of SAP systems and middleware platforms) Communicating effectively Leadership and problem-solving with fluency in navigating through a complex/matrix organization Strategic thinking What extra ingredients you will bring: Be Agile: A solid understanding and thought leader of Lean Agile delivery practices with awareness of major frameworks (i.e. SAFe, LeSS, Kanban, SoS) with the ability to lead collaborative Agile ways of working and effectively manage changing priorities. Be Scaled: Experience in leading and optimising Agile delivery at scale across multiple teams, business units and geographies. Problem Solving: Must be able lead and take ownership of proactively solving technical delivery problems end-to-end from ideation through to launch working across multiple platforms, impacting multiple services or cross Business areas. Transformation: Be able to drive and manage long term changes and adapting the Tribe(s) in line with business needs of frequent customer centric, high quality and low-cost product delivery. Coaching: Demonstrable ability to facilitate and coach multiple teams, empowering teams to self-organise, challenge, and continuously improve while providing insights for action. Industry standard qualifications in Agile Leadership (i.e. SAFe SPC, Scrum Mastering (i.e. CSM), Lean Six-Sigma, etc.) Delivery: Strong Technology delivery skillset with an understanding of building digital journeys across full lifecycle Learn, Buy, Get, Use, Pay and Serve. Leader: Leading a team of people from different locations or regions Deep understanding of the challenges that an enterprise moving to embed agility will need to address Adept at collaborating with other Senior Leaders to help drive Agile transformation to successful outcomes as well defining best practices in conjunction with the Lead Agile Coach and Delivery leadership. Hands on experiences of Scaled Agile delivery frameworks, ways of working, methods and tools including, experiences in Six Sigma and Lean thinking. Experience in the delivery of multiple technologies across the full end-to-end lifecycle of technology delivery from ideation through to market launch. Have experience in using Programme and Portfolio Management tools such as JIRA, Jira Align and Confluence. Stakeholder engagement and management, communication at all levels of the organisation. 10+ years’ experience in large scale technology delivery adopting Agility and Agile transformation programs No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. For office-based, salaried roles at Bakery and Customer Service & Logistics locations, and some remote roles proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required to be eligible for employment. Religious, medical and/or other accommodations as required by law will be considered on a case by case basis. You may review the Mondelēz COVID vaccination policy by visiting the US careers website at https://www.mondelezinternational.com/United-States. This COVID-19 vaccine mandate does not apply to several U.S. states that do not permit certain vaccination mandates, including, but not limited to Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, Florida, Indiana, Montana, North Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, and West Virginia. Job Type Regular Software & Applications Technology & Digital

jobTitle: Finance Leadership Development Associate – Finance Leadership Development Program
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter. As an organization we are committed to developing the next generation of Makers and Bakers. Joining us at an early career stage in our fast paced and ever changing environment will enable you to do more, learn more and grow more. You will be encouraged to step outside your comfort zone– you may even surprise yourself! We will ensure you are given the support you need to be at your best and enable you to be yourself and bring passion and personality. Here you can lean in and speak up and bring your own flavor. Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Get ready to Taste The Future. As an organization we are committed to developing the next generation of Makers and Bakers. Join our Taste The Future Program; our fast paced and ever-changing environment will enable you to do more, learn more and grow more. You will be encouraged to step outside your comfort zone– you may even surprise yourself! We will ensure you are given the support you need to be at your best and enable you to be yourself and bring passion and personality. Here you can lean in and speak up and bring your own flavor. Finance Associate – Finance Leadership Development Program Our Finance Leadership Development Program provides you with an opportunity to quickly develop skills and assume a leadership position early in your career. It is designed to prepare you to take a leadership role with an accelerated pace by providing you with increasingly senior and challenging roles. You will start in the North America Snacks & Confectionery business, which is based in East Hanover, New Jersey but with our global locations around the world, there really are no limits as to where your career can go! The 3-year rotational program aims to move you around the business giving you the chance to work in real roles in different areas over the course of the program. Examples include: Category Finance, Financial Planning and Reporting and Operations Finance. Along the program, you will develop functional skills and experience through a range of on-going training programs. Core skill training may include business partnering, presentation skills and influencing/negotiating. We also provide key functional training in Finance through global programs, forums, and conferences. You will also work with your line manager to create an individually tailored learning and development plan which will build on your strengths and set out your key development themes for the year. You will also have opportunities to interact with key Finance leaders within the organization, as well as gain exposure to other business units within Mondelēz International. As part of the program, you will be assigned a formal mentor who will meet with you on a regular basis and specifically focused on your development. There will also be projects and assessment during each rotational assignment. As you rotate within the program, you may be required to relocate to one of our NA locations outside of East Hanover, NJ. Relocation benefits are part of the rotational program. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting Genuine interest in a robust 3-Year rotational program Ability to analyze and interpret data to draw out insights and drive strong business decisions Demonstrate strong time management skills with attention to detail and ability to set priorities Self-motivated and driven to learn and lead Be a team player committed to the success of the team and work effectively with cross functional teams Possess demonstrated PC skills in Excel, Word and PowerPoint Exhibit excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to work out of East Hanover, NJ and relocate to plant setting, if applicable, during rotational program Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. jobTitle: Focused Improvement Pillar Leader
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? We are the creators of Oreo, Ritz Crackers, Triscuit, Sour Patch and Swedish Fish to name a few. You help implement the operational excellence program in a specific function and/or for cross-functional continuous improvement (CI) projects. You are not only responsible for applying CI tools and techniques for problem solving and performance improvement but more importantly, you help employees improve their CI skills and build their self-sufficiency. How You Will Contribute You will: Provide training on CI tools and techniques to help drive teams through CI cycles. You will also coach employees to help them achieve their targets Identify process improvement needs with department leads, facilitate sessions and support execution of newly established improvements Once improvements are done, validate outcome benefits and support creation of new standards and qualification of members into new working processes Benchmark externally, ensuring where relevant that best practice and new tools are deployed in collaboration with internal partners What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Experience implementing CI processes (e.g. TPM for manufacturing, Lean Six Sigma in the consumer goods industry) Strong facilitation and communication skills Experience in change management processes Logical thinking and capacity to influence Results oriented and prepared to deal with ambiguity Experience such as: continuous improvement manager, team leader roles, area manager More About This Role Lead the implementation of the Focused Improvement Pillar (FI) at the Chicago Bakery, through end to end loss identification, executing the Governance processes to eradicate the losses and deliver productivity. Ensure the capability building in analytical tools, and zero loss mindset is happening across the organization. Responsible for the development of GE and Waste glide-paths as well as driving the Productivity Plan. This role also plays an important role in developing the strategic implementation of FI to support the Chicago Bakery IL6S Journey. What you need to know about this position: Lead the Site FI Pillar, qualify all pillar members, and manage the pillar master to support the IL6S implementation Create the necessary capability across the site for a correct FI implementation Lead the full site Loss Analysis Process – Yearly, Quarterly and Monthly deployment Develop and cascade the Zero Loss Journey to all Pillars and Lines Support all IL6S Pillar leads on tracking and understanding their losses Develop, track and manage the site Productivity Plan – including the quarterly and yearly update Work with IIM on the capital master plan development and project scoping linked with losses Work with Finance to validate savings for capital and all other productivity projects Lead and coach 12 Step kaizen projects linked with site losses Lead and coach SMED projects linked with site losses IDF Site Admin – responsible for system implementation, reporting, and user capability Develop line and site KPI tracking to provide visibility of results Build zero loss mindset throughout the organization through training and coaching Acts as a change agent in implementing IL6S methodology in the organization Maintain and create appropriate documentation for reports, project execution, and data analysis Schedule: Monday - Friday Qualifications: BS degree in Engineering or a related field preferred Minimum of 5 years’ experience (7 years preferred) managing process improvement teams in a manufacturing environment Experience in Focused Improvement implementation Ability to create high performance work teams Problem-solving and data analysis expert - Six Sigma Green or Black Belt Preferred Proficient experience delivering quantified results through cross-functional teams – leading and coaching Strong computer skills; proficient in the use of MS Office applications, specifically Excel Experience with Minitab and other statistical analysis tools strongly preferred. Experienced and active in employee engagement activities Ability to work off-shifts and weekends as required by the business Leadership Competencies: Process management Building effective teams Strategic agility Managing vision and purpose Creativity and Outside the box thinking No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Full-Time Nabisco Retail Merchandiser/Stocker Order Writer
jobDescription: Job Description Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Are you ready to make it happen at Mondelēz International? Full-time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser Order Writer Become one of our Full Time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser (Order Writer) by fulfilling the merchandising needs of our grocery-related customers through stocking the shelves and building and maintaining displays and partnering up with nationally recognized customers such as Walmart, Target, Kroger and more. Become an ambassador of world-famous brands like Oreo, Ritz, belVita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among other delicious industry-leading snacks. Carry out instore visits according to Mondelez’ visit method. Order product (via iPad Tablet) for shelf and display to ensure in stock conditions. Ensure Nabisco leading brands (Oreo, Ritz, Belvita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among others) are well represented, stocked and maintained through the implementation of Mondelēz’ guidelines. Ensure Sales Representative’s negotiations with store managers are being followed and communicate any issues with Mondelēz management team. Follow the daily route planning prepared by the operations team to ensure the most efficient instore service. Represent Mondelēz International in front of in store employees and work closely with sales representative to optimize visibility of Mondelez products on shelves and the construction of promotional displays. Enhance seasonal sales, seasonal displays, and new product launches. Professional, positive, and upbeat attitude while representing Mondelēz in store. Who is a good fit? Be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license and proof of auto insurance High School Diploma or GED preferred Ability to drive your personal vehicle to a variety of store locations (mileage will be reimbursed). Ability to perform hard work in a fast-paced work environment and to meet the defined physical activities like Repetitive lifting bending, and carrying up to 25 lbs., occasionally over 50 lbs., pushing & pulling over. This includes physically moving our products from the stock rooms and stocking the store’s shelves. Previous retail / grocery experience is a plus Live within 25-35 miles range from the primary location Walled Lake, Michigan Secondary Locations:Farmington Hills, Michigan Schedule availability required: Tuesday - Saturday What you can expect from us: The Full Time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser (Order Writer) position offers an hourly compensation rate starting at $17.50 based on relative experience. 5% Quarterly Bonus Plan. Paid vacation and holidays. Insurance Benefits, Medical, dental and vision benefit package. Employee Assistance Program. Safety equipment such as kneeling pads, safety knives, PPE. Growth opportunities within the company. Tuition Reimbursement Plan. Business Unit Summary We are the makers and bakers of iconic brands including Oreo, Chips Ahoy!, Ritz, Triscuit, Swedish Fish, Sour Patch Kids and many others. The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our snacks are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. Job Type Regular Field Sales Sales

Become an ambassador of world-famous brands like Oreo, Ritz, belVita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among other delicious industry-leading snacks. Carry out instore visits according to Mondelez’ visit method. Order product (via iPad Tablet) for shelf and display to ensure in stock conditions. Ensure Nabisco leading brands (Oreo, Ritz, Belvita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among others) are well represented, stocked and maintained through the implementation of Mondelēz’ guidelines. Ensure Sales Representative’s negotiations with store managers are being followed and communicate any issues with Mondelēz management team. Follow the daily route planning prepared by the operations team to ensure the most efficient instore service. Represent Mondelēz International in front of in store employees and work closely with sales representative to optimize visibility of Mondelez products on shelves and the construction of promotional displays. Enhance seasonal sales, seasonal displays, and new product launches. Professional, positive, and upbeat attitude while representing Mondelēz in store. Who is a good fit? Be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license and proof of auto insurance High School Diploma or GED preferred Ability to drive your personal vehicle to a variety of store locations (mileage will be reimbursed). Ability to perform hard work in a fast-paced work environment and to meet the defined physical activities like Repetitive lifting bending, and carrying up to 25 lbs., occasionally over 50 lbs., pushing & pulling over. This includes physically moving our products from the stock rooms and stocking the store’s shelves. Previous retail / grocery experience is a plus Live within 25-35 miles range from the primary location: Waco, TX Secondary locations: Bellmeade, Woodway and Hewitt Schedule availability required: 5 days/ 40 hours per week, 8 hours per day, start time 7am, 1 weekend day required. What you can expect from us: The Full Time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser (Order Writer) position offers an hourly compensation rate starting at $17.00 based on relative experience. 5% Quarterly Bonus Plan. Paid vacation and holidays. Insurance Benefits, Medical, dental and vision benefit package. Employee Assistance Program. Safety equipment such as kneeling pads, safety knives, PPE. Reimbursement of business internet/data expenses up to $10/per month. Growth opportunities within the company. Tuition Reimbursement Plan. Business Unit Summary We are the makers and bakers of iconic brands including Oreo, Chips Ahoy!, Ritz, Triscuit, Swedish Fish, Sour Patch Kids and many others. The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our snacks are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. Job Type Regular Field Sales Sales

Become an ambassador of world-famous brands like Oreo, Ritz, belVita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among other delicious industry-leading snacks. Carry out instore visits according to Mondelez’ visit method. Order product (via iPad Tablet) for shelf and display to ensure in stock conditions. Ensure Nabisco leading brands (Oreo, Ritz, Belvita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among others) are well represented, stocked and maintained through the implementation of Mondelēz’ guidelines. Ensure Sales Representative’s negotiations with store managers are being followed and communicate any issues with Mondelēz management team. Follow the daily route planning prepared by the operations team to ensure the most efficient instore service. Represent Mondelēz International in front of in store employees and work closely with sales representative to optimize visibility of Mondelez products on shelves and the construction of promotional displays. Enhance seasonal sales, seasonal displays, and new product launches. Professional, positive, and upbeat attitude while representing Mondelēz in store. Who is a good fit? Be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license and proof of auto insurance High School Diploma or GED preferred Ability to drive your personal vehicle to a variety of store locations (mileage will be reimbursed). Ability to perform hard work in a fast-paced work environment and to meet the defined physical activities like Repetitive lifting bending, and carrying up to 25 lbs., occasionally over 50 lbs., pushing & pulling over. This includes physically moving our products from the stock rooms and stocking the store’s shelves. Previous retail / grocery experience is a plus Live within 25-35 miles range from the primary location: Columbus, IN Secondary location: Seymour, IN Schedule availability required: Flexible weekdays, 1 weekend day required - Morning Shift What you can expect from us: The Full Time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser (Order Writer) position offers an hourly compensation rate starting at $15.00 based on relative experience. 5% Quarterly Bonus Plan. Paid vacation and holidays. This position is eligible for a $500 Hiring Bonus Insurance Benefits, Medical, dental and vision benefit package. Employee Assistance Program. Safety equipment such as kneeling pads, safety knives, PPE. Growth opportunities within the company. Tuition Reimbursement Plan. Business Unit Summary We are the makers and bakers of iconic brands including Oreo, Chips Ahoy!, Ritz, Triscuit, Swedish Fish, Sour Patch Kids and many others. The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our snacks are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. Job Type Regular Field Sales Sales

Full-time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser Order Writer Become one of our Full Time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser (Order Writer) by fulfilling the merchandising needs of our grocery-related customers through stocking the shelves and building and maintaining displays and partnering up with nationally recognized customers such as Walmart, Target, Food Lion and more. Become an ambassador of world-famous brands like Oreo, Ritz, belVita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among other delicious industry-leading snacks. Carry out instore visits according to Mondelez’ visit method. Order product (via iPad Tablet) for shelf and display to ensure in stock conditions. Ensure Nabisco leading brands (Oreo, Ritz, Belvita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among others) are well represented, stocked and maintained through the implementation of Mondelēz’ guidelines. Ensure Sales Representative’s negotiations with store managers are being followed and communicate any issues with Mondelēz management team. Follow the daily route planning prepared by the operations team to ensure the most efficient instore service. Represent Mondelēz International in front of in store employees and work closely with sales representative to optimize visibility of Mondelez products on shelves and the construction of promotional displays. Enhance seasonal sales, seasonal displays, and new product launches. Professional, positive, and upbeat attitude while representing Mondelēz in store. Who is a good fit? Be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license and proof of auto insurance High School Diploma or GED preferred Ability to drive your personal vehicle to a variety of store locations (mileage will be reimbursed). Ability to perform hard work in a fast-paced work environment and to meet the defined physical activities like Repetitive lifting bending, and carrying up to 25 lbs., occasionally over 50 lbs., pushing & pulling over. This includes physically moving our products from the stock rooms and stocking the store’s shelves. Previous retail / grocery experience is a plus Live within 25-35 miles range from the primary location: Raleigh, NC Secondary locations: Knightdale, NC. Schedule availability required: 5 days including 1 Weekend day What you can expect from us: The Full Time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser (Order Writer) position offers an hourly compensation rate starting at $15+ based on relative experience. 5% Quarterly Bonus Plan. Paid vacation and holidays. Insurance Benefits, Medical, dental and vision benefit package. Employee Assistance Program. Safety equipment such as kneeling pads, safety knives, PPE. Growth opportunities within the company. Tuition Reimbursement Plan Business Unit Summary We are the makers and bakers of iconic brands including Oreo, Chips Ahoy!, Ritz, Triscuit, Swedish Fish, Sour Patch Kids and many others. The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our snacks are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. Job Type Regular Field Sales Sales

Become an ambassador of world-famous brands like Oreo, Ritz, belVita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among other delicious industry-leading snacks. Carry out instore visits according to Mondelez’ visit method. Order product (via iPad Tablet) for shelf and display to ensure in stock conditions. Ensure Nabisco leading brands (Oreo, Ritz, Belvita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among others) are well represented, stocked and maintained through the implementation of Mondelēz’ guidelines. Ensure Sales Representative’s negotiations with store managers are being followed and communicate any issues with Mondelēz management team. Follow the daily route planning prepared by the operations team to ensure the most efficient instore service. Represent Mondelēz International in front of in store employees and work closely with sales representative to optimize visibility of Mondelez products on shelves and the construction of promotional displays. Enhance seasonal sales, seasonal displays, and new product launches. Professional, positive, and upbeat attitude while representing Mondelēz in store. Who is a good fit? Be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license and proof of auto insurance High School Diploma or GED preferred Ability to drive your personal vehicle to a variety of store locations (mileage will be reimbursed). Ability to perform hard work in a fast-paced work environment and to meet the defined physical activities like Repetitive lifting bending, and carrying up to 25 lbs., occasionally over 50 lbs., pushing & pulling over. This includes physically moving our products from the stock rooms and stocking the store’s shelves. Previous retail / grocery experience is a plus Live within 25 miles range from the primary location: East Hanover, NJ Schedule availability required: 5 days a week, with 1 weekend day required. What you can expect from us: The Full Time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser (Order Writer) position offers an hourly compensation rate at $18.00. 5% Quarterly Bonus Plan. Paid vacation and holidays. Insurance Benefits, Medical, dental and vision benefit package. Employee Assistance Program. Safety equipment such as kneeling pads, safety knives, PPE. Growth opportunities within the company. Tuition Reimbursement Plan. Business Unit Summary We are the makers and bakers of iconic brands including Oreo, Chips Ahoy!, Ritz, Triscuit, Swedish Fish, Sour Patch Kids and many others. The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our snacks are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. Job Type Regular Field Sales Sales

jobDescription: Job Description Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Are you ready to make it happen at Mondelēz International? Full-time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser Order Writer Primary location: Aberdeen SD Secondary cities: Watertown SD Disclaimer: To be considered for this position, you must live within 25 miles range from the primary location. Schedule: Sunday, Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday Disclaimer: To be considered for this position, you must have the flexibility to adjust to the established schedule. Become one of our Full Time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser (Order Writer) by fulfilling the merchandising needs of our grocery-related customers through stocking the shelves and building and maintaining displays and partnering up with nationally recognized customers such as Walmart, Kroger, Target and more. Become an ambassador of world-famous brands like Oreo, Ritz, belVita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among other delicious industry-leading snacks. Our local customers include Walmart, Target, Hy Vee, Fareway, Price Chopper and more. Carry out instore visits according to Mondelez’ visit method. Order product (via iPad Tablet) for shelf and display to ensure in stock conditions. Ensure Nabisco leading brands (Oreo, Ritz, Belvita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among others) are well represented, stocked and maintained through the implementation of Mondelēz’ guidelines. Ensure Sales Representative’s negotiations with store managers are being followed and communicate any issues with Mondelēz management team. Follow the daily route planning prepared by the operations team to ensure the most efficient instore service. Represent Mondelēz International in front of in store employees and work closely with sales representative to optimize visibility of Mondelez products on shelves and the construction of promotional displays. Enhance seasonal sales, seasonal displays, and new product launches. Professional, positive, and upbeat attitude while representing Mondelēz in store. Who is a good fit? Be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license and proof of auto insurance High School Diploma or GED preferred Ability to drive your personal vehicle to a variety of store locations (mileage will be reimbursed). This position requires the ability to perform hard work in a fast-paced work environment while meeting the defined physical activities below: Repetitive motions Being on your feet working top stock, back stock (moving carts & pallets), building displays, removing displays and merchandising loads to the shelf Pulling, pushing, lifting, bending, kneeling, squatting, carrying between 25 lbs. up to 50 lbs., Checking in and out with the store manager Tracking any issues with the sales representative keeping in mind that safety is first Previous retail / grocery experience is a plus. What you can expect from us: The Full Time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser (Order Writer) position offers an hourly compensation rate starting at $16.00 based on relative experience. 5% Quarterly Bonus Plan. Paid vacation and holidays. Insurance Benefits, Medical, dental and vision benefit package. Employee Assistance Program. Safety equipment such as kneeling pads, safety knives, PPE. This position offers a $300 hiring bonus. Growth opportunities within the company. Tuition Reimbursement Plan. Business Unit Summary We are the makers and bakers of iconic brands including Oreo, Chips Ahoy!, Ritz, Triscuit, Swedish Fish, Sour Patch Kids and many others. The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our snacks are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Full-time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser Order Writer Primary location: Spencer IA Secondary cities: Spirit Lake IA Disclaimer: To be considered for this position, you must live within 25 miles range from the primary location. Schedule: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday Disclaimer: To be considered for this position, you must have the flexibility to adjust to the established schedule. Become one of our Full Time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser (Order Writer) by fulfilling the merchandising needs of our grocery-related customers through stocking the shelves and building and maintaining displays and partnering up with nationally recognized customers such as Walmart, Kroger, Target and more. Become an ambassador of world-famous brands like Oreo, Ritz, belVita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among other delicious industry-leading snacks. Our local customers include Walmart, Target, Hy Vee, Fareway, Price Chopper and more. Carry out instore visits according to Mondelez’ visit method. Order product (via iPad Tablet) for shelf and display to ensure in stock conditions. Ensure Nabisco leading brands (Oreo, Ritz, Belvita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among others) are well represented, stocked and maintained through the implementation of Mondelēz’ guidelines. Ensure Sales Representative’s negotiations with store managers are being followed and communicate any issues with Mondelēz management team. Follow the daily route planning prepared by the operations team to ensure the most efficient instore service. Represent Mondelēz International in front of in store employees and work closely with sales representative to optimize visibility of Mondelez products on shelves and the construction of promotional displays. Enhance seasonal sales, seasonal displays, and new product launches. Professional, positive, and upbeat attitude while representing Mondelēz in store. Who is a good fit? Be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license and proof of auto insurance High School Diploma or GED preferred Ability to drive your personal vehicle to a variety of store locations (mileage will be reimbursed). This position requires the ability to perform hard work in a fast-paced work environment while meeting the defined physical activities below: Repetitive motions Being on your feet working top stock, back stock (moving carts & pallets), building displays, removing displays and merchandising loads to the shelf Pulling, pushing, lifting, bending, kneeling, squatting, carrying between 25 lbs. up to 50 lbs., Checking in and out with the store manager Tracking any issues with the sales representative keeping in mind that safety is first Previous retail / grocery experience is a plus. What you can expect from us: The Full Time Nabisco Sales Service Representative/Merchandiser (Order Writer) position offers an hourly compensation rate starting at $16.00 based on relative experience. 5% Quarterly Bonus Plan. Paid vacation and holidays. Insurance Benefits, Medical, dental and vision benefit package. Employee Assistance Program. Safety equipment such as kneeling pads, safety knives, PPE. This position offers a $300 hiring bonus. Growth opportunities within the company. Tuition Reimbursement Plan. Business Unit Summary We are the makers and bakers of iconic brands including Oreo, Chips Ahoy!, Ritz, Triscuit, Swedish Fish, Sour Patch Kids and many others. The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our snacks are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. Job Type Regular Field Sales Sales
