jobTitle: Maintenance Lead
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International / Nabisco? We are the creators of Oreo, Ritz Crackers, Triscuit, Sour Patch and Swedish Fish to name a few. Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. Our goal is to achieve zero breakdowns and efficient maintenance costs. The Maintenance Supervisor will be key in this objective by coordinating planned corrective, preventive and predictive maintenance activities through the technical development of the maintenance and operation teams of your production lines. This role will focus on loss eradication (breakdown) and implementation of line E2E reliability using all progressive maintenance pillar tools, maintenance and condition-based monitoring technologies, leadership in maintenance, repairs and operations/spare parts, utilization of SAP maintenance module and skills development. To define success, we will use key metrics such as injury rate, GE (equipment reliability), MTBF (mean time between failures), %TBM/CBM completed, PM Pillar progress on your line, inventory value and accuracy, fixed cost management (spare parts, contracted services, emergency purchases, labor). How You Will Contribute As Maintenance Lead you will: Ensure teams generate corrective work orders from critical preventive maintenance and CBM reviews. Manage the schedule for the reform of machinery and equipment, through reports and information from PCP (Production Planning and Control). Lead and implement strategies to increase the reliability of all production line equipment. Maintain the operational efficiency of machinery and equipment through compliance with preventive maintenance programs and renovations. Support management of suppliers for contracted maintenance. Manage documented information for predictive and preventive maintenance, basic equipment operating conditions and improvements implemented in the production and related areas. Coordinate training for maintenance and operations on operating conditions and improvements implemented in production area and related equipment. Manage the creation of documented information on basic equipment operating conditions and improvements implemented in the production and related areas. Manage maintenance costs. Promptly serve internal and external customers whenever requested by GDD (Day to Day Management). Take care of the order, storage and conservation of materials and equip. Support AM step journey at the line What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Maintenance Lead: Effective at being a Servant Leader, leading and managing change and building a high performing team Trust, empowers and gives coaching to the team, while holding every individual accountable Knowledge of Continuous Improvement process such as TPM and Lean Manufacturing. Proven PM (Progressive Maintenance) expertise, including Planned Maintenance Root cause analysis and Condition Based Maintenance Experience in a union environment Experience in food industry preferred. SAP PM Module experience preferred. Demonstrated ability to make major and rapid changes to a strong legacy organization. Improving parts management and purchasing a plus. More About This Role Education / Certifications: Bachelor's Degree required, with a technical focus preferred. As Engineering (Mechatronic / Electronic) Job specific requirements: Minimum 5 years’ experience in a Maintenance Environment Minimum of 3 years’ experience in Leading Maintenance Teams Electrical license is preferred Work schedule: Mostly M-F / 2nd shift 3:00pm -11:00pm No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Maintenance Manager
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. Your goal will be to ensure that the site manufacturing & support activities, without interruption, without any facilities shortages and/or any issues thereof. You will achieve 100% compliance to Local legal regulations, Quality, Health Safety & Environment management systems and standards. You are responsible for the management and maintenance of site facilities, buildings and equipment(s) (hardware & software). How you will contribute You will: Works cross functionally to develop and implement a strategic Facilities road-map and annual operating plan which is a competitive advantage to Mondelēz. Partner with internal & external stakeholders and service providers to define and meet Safety, Quality, Cost, Delivery, Sustainability, Engagement goals. Establish a strong governance to review & control Operational performance and continuous Improvement plan to deliver against best in class both internally and externally. Lead and be accountable that Building Maintenance program, Facilities maintenance program capabilities, including maintenance repairs & overall operations are in place. Accountable to insure adherence to business continuity plan, manufacturing standards government regulations are understood by all employees/services providers at the site, regularly reviewed and monitored for effective implementation. Provide leadership, coaching to Facilities team towards implementation of IL6S-Integrated Lean 6 sigma ways of working: delivering zero breakdowns via preventive/predictive maintenance strategies and technical mastery of maintenance and operation teams; PM (Progressive Maintenance) Pillar, and CBM (condition based monitoring), Visual controls & tools Mgmt., Lubrication mgmt. & Calibration of equipment(s) etc. Role model Values and principles through effective coaching, mentoring and builds skills capability across the Plant technical/engineering team to engage with latest modern practices. Have a clear people succession and resource plan, for the asset & technology population , identifying and implementing critical levers to attract, retain and develop critical talent Interface with key stakeholders internally and externally to develop and maintain effective relationships, align priorities in order to deliver the company objectives, and goals. What you will bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Strong operational & manufacturing leadership experience in CPG industry with experience in TPM-Total productive maintenance, 5s, LEAN, 6 sigma tools and concepts, Safety & GMP standards An Engineer with a strong financial & business acumen, project management skills and Knowledge of industrial maintenance and manufacturing equipment, PM (Progressive Maintenance) expertise, Spare parts management, SAP PM module end user knowledge, Technology & Engineering automation basics. Excellent communication (verbal & written), coaching, and leadership skills in a team-based environment. Demonstrated abilities in Analytics, problem solving and team building The Maintenance Manager is directly responsible for improving the total uptime performance of the site’s Production and Utility assets by leading the teams with a sense of urgency, focusing on the execution of the preventative/predictive maintenance programs, and setting the standard for the “quality execution” of these plans by both in-house and third-party resources. This person will be responsible for implementing the overall Progressive Maintenance Strategy at the site, including optimization of cost-effective maintenance & reliability strategies in support of IL6S and the plant business deliverables, as well as coordinating technical training opportunities for all associates to increase skill and knowledge basis. The PM Leads, Asset Reliability Manager, and Facilities and Utility Manager will report to this position. Responsibilities Aggressively implements & maintains the plant Progressive Maintenance Improvement Plan and Roadmap aligned with plant / BU priorities. Proactively evaluates & leads refinement of overall equipment reliability plans, strategies, equipment performance & RCA effectiveness. Manages both production and facility/utility asset maintenance & infrastructure to ensure the most effective use of resources & funding balanced for both short- & long-range plans in addition to plant production assets. Champions a proactive Preventative/proactive driven culture that optimizes cost effective maintenance & reliability for the line / plant. Ensures necessary skill sets are developed, refined & maintained Supports the plant teams in reviewing / developing operating standards, line speeds, Global Efficiency (GE), etc, to identify and capitalize on improvement opportunities. Coaches, mentors & develops Maintenance leadership staff. Coordinate production equipment and facility maintenance activities at the plant, including capital projects with support of corporate engineering to maximize equipment reliability, efficiency, and cost. Ensure that all maintenance activities pertaining to the adherence to/implementation of people safety and risk management regulations and procedures, according to the company policies and FM Global recommendations, are executed Champion GE improvement initiatives, as well as selection, implementation, and monitoring of equipment reliability improvement plans. Responsible for ensuring products are produced in accordance with Good Manufacturing Practices (GMPs) and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). Is responsible for ensuring that all applicable safety and GMP procedures are understood and adhered to Understands and follow Manufacturing food safety systems and procedures Is responsible for ensuring that all food safety and quality issues are brought to the immediate attention of the Quality Manager Other duties as assigned Who is a great fit: Engineering degree 5 years' experience in a similar Maintenance Leadership role Previous experience with Proactive Maintenance and other TPM or related Integrated Lean Six Sigma reliability programs a plus Demonstrates strong communication skills, both verbal and written Demosntrates excellent organizational, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills Ability to interpret drawingsm technical manuals, specifications and regulations Demonstrates ability to develop corporate/business relationships along with keen business acumen and a solid undesratnding of the maintenance costs Demonstrates hands-on leadership and coaching abilities. Able to demonstrate several examples of empowering, developing & motivating people Demonstrates effective problem resolution skills combined with "big picture" awareness Demonstrates high level of interpersonal and communication skills, and ability to lead and participate in a multi-functional, team-based environment ocordinating closely under the direction of the Site Operations Director. Demonstrates ability to negage with Government Authorities Enforcement Agencies, Professional Associations, Business Schools/University , etc. Physical effort: work normally requires a low level of physical effort in bedning, lifting and manual dexterity. Computer/telephone use is moderate. Some occasional travel to attend meetings/audits as needed locally. Ability to stand for long periods of time is essential. Frequent walking. Work normally requires a moderate level of mental effort in reading, creating written documentation, meeting deadlines, problem solving, handling multiple demands and repetitive tasks, amid constant interruptions and distractions. Must understand and prioritize Good Manufacturing Practices, People and Food Safety considerations into daily decision making and prioritization efforts. This position is located in our Chicago Bakery | 7300 S Kedzie Avenue, Chicago IL, 60629. No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelē

jobTitle: Maintenance Mechanic (Hourly compensation fixed rate: $33.10 subject to relevant experience)
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. As part of Manufacturing, you’ll use your skills, our systems and a wide array of raw materials to help create the delicious finished products our consumers love. While taking ownership in your area of work, you’ll also ensure the safety of yourself and your colleagues while producing our top-quality products reliably and efficiently within our integrated supply chain. Purpose of the role Perform preventive maintenance on plant equipment to keep in good running order. Troubleshoot problems, recommend and perform mechanical repairs to minimize downtime. Work collaboratively with Operations Team to share knowledge and contribute to a Continuous Improvement environment. How You Will Contribute You will: Utilize mechanical ability and knowledge to repair, replace defective parts and equipment. Ability to read and interpret drawings, blueprints or sketches. Working knowledge to include (but not restricted to) pumps, hydraulics, pneumatics, drives, machining of parts, some electrical knowledge, hand tool usage, and welding. Must be qualified to operate forklifts, manlifts, ladders and scaffolds. Work effectively with electrical, boiler room, and/ or operations personnel when needed. Participate in groups or teams to enhance the reliability and productivity of equipment and processes. Report all work through a computerized maintenance system (SAP). Assist enhancements to computerized maintenance system. Work efficiently and effectively with minimal supervision in a team environment. Knowledge and complete usage of Lock out tag out, hot work permits, confined space permits. Protect the company's investment in machinery and equipment by exercising proper care, skill and knowledge in the use of Company investments. Support and participate in business initiatives ie. HACCP, QCMS, etc. Required High School Diploma or general education degree (GED) Preferred associate's degree in a technical or industrial field Preferred 2 years manufacturing experience Ability to work any shift, weekends, and holidays as required Ability to work well in a team-based environment with limited supervision Able to learn and apply Continuous Improvement tools (IL6S) Capable of working effectively as part of a High-Performance Team Ability to problem solve and help with practical solutions The following physical demands are examples of duties that may be performed: Climb steps Lift 50 pounds and maintain balance Ability to perform duties in extreme varying temperatures Crawl over, under and into equipment as necessary to perform job duties Work from ladders and lifts Benefits These are some of the great benefits that you will be entitled for: Health, Group life insurance and Saving plan. Thirteen paid Holidays per year. Increasing paid time off. Increasing hourly wage during the first 12 months of contract. Monday – Friday schedule Weekends wage differential, Saturday (1.5 x) Sunday (2 x) 2nd Shift Differential $0.75/hr, 3rd Shift Differential $1.50/hr Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Maintenance Team Leader
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. As expert you will bring a deep technical mastery of the process and equipment. That expertise allows you to lead the planning, process development and implementation of Planned Maintenance Elements in a Continuous Improvement manufacturing environment. You will manage this through teams consisting of various technical and non-technical personnel, key support contractors and operations personnel. How You Will Contribute You will: Partner & Enable the line leader(s) to deliver the SQCDSM targets-Safety, Quality, Cost, Delivery, Sustainability & Morale for the lines, to ensure Process stability; Participates in the DMS- Daily Management systems meetings at the shift and line level Own the technology and process and centerline settings for the equipment and process and have deep technical mastery of the process and equipment; Owns the PM-Progressive maintenance systems and work processes and the PM-Progressive Maintenance Key Performance Indicators for the line/s along with Centerline Management systems; owns the R&M-Repairs & Maintenance budget of the line Develop, own and execute the line/s preventive and time-based maintenance systems and plans and build capability of the team to execute themselves; Build (spends at least 50% of time) technical and maintenance skills of the technicians working in the shifts, so that they are able to operate and maintain their equipment themselves; be part of the PM Pillar, own all PM systems and work process at the line level and lead some of them at the department level Partner with the Asset and Reliability team for system improvement and execution of special maintenance tasks; be responsible for Change Management on the line/s, localization of spares and proper break-down analysis and R&M cost reduction for the line/s; Represents the department/line/s as the site technology owner in the regional and global technology forums Assist in VSU for the new initiatives and enable the VSU team; Help the line leader in internal and external benchmarking and reapplication; be the subject matter expert on one of the component categories and be a trainer of PM related subjects for the plant What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Advanced knowledge (including AM-Autonomous Maintenance Step 4 systems & Progressive Maintenance Step 3) & skill to maintain the dedicated equipment(s)at basic conditions independently, including the execution of AM & PM (BD-Breakdown maintenance, planned maintenance) standards on dedicated equipment(s) and TPM - Phase 3 & 4 tools problem solving tools The capability to lead a Role for the Line. Qualify and coach the next level SWP owners and drive the common opportunity areas across the line in PDCA-Plan Do Check Adjust approach The capability to work as the Line Leader, developing and aligning goal/master plan for the line, deploying and managing IDP for the members, coaching team members on their performance management and career development Education / Certifications: High School Required Bachelors preferred Work schedule: Monday - Friday No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Manager, Accounting & External Reporting
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours. You will develop and implement accounting practices and procedures. You will provide and interpret data from accounting records and coordinate accounting services and integrate them with operating needs. In this role, you will oversee the management of such processes as fixed assets, leases, intercompany cross charges, new accounting rules, restructuring programs, and accounting for joint ventures, among others. This role may also include people management responsibilities. How You Will Contribute You will: Manage elements of the monthly accounting close process including ensuring accurate and timely U.S. GAAP/local GAAP reporting and the timeliness and integrity of local financial reports, balance sheet reconciliations and KPIs. You will also provide insights into balance sheet movements and cash flow and support implementation of process change projects Ensure a strong controls and compliance environment in your area of scope and ensure full compliance with our AER policies Coordinate accounting services and integrate them with operating needs. You will also provide and interpret data from accounting records as needed Lead projects to drive for harmonization, efficiencies and improvements to ways of working on AER processes and systems such as SAP, SLAN and FIT/HFM reporting tools and build a mindset of continuous improvement within the team. You will also lead implementation efforts on new accounting guidance Build a high-performing Accounting and External Reporting (AER) team (Mondelēz International employees and Mondelēz International Business Services business partner). Depending on the nature of the role, your job may involve recruiting and developing talent across AER and to drive our AER talent agenda globally What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in: TECHNICAL EXPERTISE in accounting and external reporting including understanding of U.S. GAAP, IFRS or local GAAP, close processes and financial reporting systems. Expertise in policy, controls and compliance design including SOX reporting. General knowledge of tax laws and indirect and direct tax BUSINESS ACUMEN and an understanding of our business and finance beyond accounting and external reporting scope LEADERSHIP SKILLS including proven business partnering and communication skills. Experience of working as a finance leader managing cross-functional and business partner teams to drive timely and accurate results GROWTH/DIGITAL MINDSET and the ability to identify strategic opportunities and leverage technology to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness INTEGRITY and sound judgement in all decisions and interactions aligned with our values and policies and external regulations The Manager, Accounting and External Reporting is responsible for managing the external reporting process, authoring financial statement and footnote disclosures, driving conclusions on technical accounting positions and the implementation of process improvements. The role will lead projects to create reporting efficiencies as well as assess the impacts of new accounting guidance. The role will manage compliance with our internal control framework and address accounting issues with the external auditor team. Additionally, this person will provide guidance to the regions for lease accounting matters and prepare quarterly lease disclosures. Manage all aspects of periodic, quarterly and annual SEC filings including detailed planning, cross-functional coordination, preparation of financial statements and footnotes, and review of the entire report. Partner with external auditors during quarterly review and annual audit processes. Work closely with regional business leaders, corporate communications, legal and investor relations related to our external filings, investor presentations and related public releases and statements. Develop, maintain and ensure compliance with internal controls related to reporting processes and SEC filings. Assist with certain technical accounting matters, including carrying out research and documentation for a variety of complex and non-standard transactions when needed. Complete quarterly reporting for lease accounting for senior finance leaders. Ensure accounting and processes are compliant with policy and accounting standard requirements. Support internal and external audit requirements with Lease COE and Region Lease Leads. Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, commerce, Business Administration or similar degree, CPA preferred Minimum of 5 or more years of experience in Accounting Big 4 Accounting Firm audit experience preferred Experience in a multinational company is ideal Experience with general ledger systems, and responsibility for monthly closes Experience with internal control design and SOX reporting Hyperion and SAP experience is strongly preferred Extremely systems savvy with exceptional Excel skills Ability to manage other functions Ability to simplify complex guidance Clear and concise communication No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. jobTitle: Manager Accounting & External Reporting, Lease Accounting
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours. You will develop and implement accounting practices and procedures. You will provide and interpret data from accounting records and coordinate accounting services and integrate them with operating needs. In this role, you will oversee the management of such processes as fixed assets, leases, intercompany cross charges, new accounting rules, restructuring programs, and accounting for joint ventures, among others. This role will also include people management responsibilities. How You Will Contribute You will: Manage elements of the monthly accounting close process including ensuring accurate and timely U.S. GAAP/local GAAP reporting and the timeliness and integrity of local financial reports, balance sheet reconciliations and KPIs. You will also provide insights into balance sheet movements and cash flow and support implementation of process change projects Ensure a strong controls and compliance environment in your area of scope and ensure full compliance with our AER policies Coordinate accounting services and integrate them with operating needs. You will also provide and interpret data from accounting records as needed Lead projects to drive for harmonization, efficiencies and improvements to ways of working on AER processes and systems such as SAP, SLAN and FIT/HFM reporting tools and build a mindset of continuous improvement within the team. You will also lead implementation efforts on new accounting guidance Build a high-performing Accounting and External Reporting (AER) team (Mondelēz International employees and Mondelēz International Business Services business partner). Depending on the nature of the role, your job may involve recruiting and developing talent across AER and to drive our AER talent agenda globally What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in: TECHNICAL EXPERTISE in accounting and external reporting including understanding of U.S. GAAP, IFRS or local GAAP, close processes and financial reporting systems. Expertise in policy, controls and compliance design including SOX reporting. General knowledge of tax laws and indirect and direct tax BUSINESS ACUMEN and an understanding of our business and finance beyond accounting and external reporting scope LEADERSHIP SKILLS including proven business partnering and communication skills. jobTitle: Manager, Business Analytics Support
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. Responsible for the Applications Support Services for Business Intelligence & Data Analytics systems at Mondelēz International. This position is required to govern Application Management Services in Americas region, ensuring Service Providers meet Mondelez’s application support and software development expectations. Has a deep understanding of the business processes, the systems that support them, and the IS processes involved (i.e. Incident, Problem, Change, and Release Management). Acts as a liaison and key enabler between vendors, End User community and other Mondelez IS organizations (such as Business Partners, Solution Experts, Architects, IT Services, Application Security & Compliance, etc.), ensuring systems continue running the Business operations flawlessly. Lead Application support services of Data Analytics Platforms. Work in close partnership with AMS & business leadership team to execute the analytics agenda Propose and demonstrate new opportunities and insights through Data Analytics, serves as Analytics lead and Subject matter expert internally within the Data Analytics function and externally. Collaborates with other business leaders to execute Data Analytics agenda. Manage internal teams and partner with external suppliers to drive operational excellence, Applications support and delivery of Data Analytics Programs. Ensure accomplishment of support service level objectives and key performance indicators in partnership with service providers and software vendors. Budget planning follow up on requisitions, purchase orders, invoices and payments, explore opportunities to leverage scale and drive savings. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Strong technical experience in Enterprise Data Warehouse & Analytics Platforms, Data Visualization and Reporting tools. Deep subject matter expertise in state-of-art solutions which fit into the overall Data & Analytics strategy, roadmap, and solution architecture. Leadership experience in deploying new analytical approaches in a complex and highly matrixed organization. Influencing skills to drive the business agenda and make recommendation to Analytics leaders in the organization. Contract Management: Collaborates in ensuring contract terms and conditions are met by Service Providers and Mondelez Collaborates in the revision and adjustment of contract scope, terms and conditions as necessary, Collaborates with management and follow-up of requisitions, purchase orders, invoices, and payments Collaborates with contract expiration management and renewals Ensures Procurement Policies are strictly followed Explores opportunities to leverage scale, and drive savings Service Management: Ensures accomplishment of Support Service Level Objectives and Key Performance Indicators working in partnership with Service Providers and Software Vendors. Ensures support services readiness for new major releases/rollouts. Supervises adequate Transition to Support. Escalation point for incidents and incident resolution facilitator. Jointly with Partner, establishes, collaborates and monitors a Continuous Improvement plan to identify and remove the service delivery gaps. Establishes weekly and monthly service status review meetings with key stakeholders (Business , IS and Service Providers) Monitors OLA agreements, ensuring seamless end to end delivery of services Critical Incident Management: Escalation point for Critical Situations and incident resolution facilitator. Collaborates with CIM Team on P1/P2 situations Collaborates with CIM Team post-critical situation assessment and Problem Mgmt. Financial Management: Collaborates in defining the Application Support Budget, and, controls expenses. Continuously seeks cost reduction opportunities. Collaborates in Value Transformation goal achievement for the region. Collaborates in the calculation of TCO (Total Cost of Ownership) of applications. Processes Management :Ensures and promotes ITIL best practices for Incident, Problem, Change, Release management within IS and Service Providers. Collaborates in Support Processes and Tools definition, implementation and monitoring Collaboratively seeks Continuous Improvement, simplification and harmonization of IS processes across regions, ensuring benefits are delivered. Collaborates with Application Services Transformational objectives (Business oriented SLA’s, Run SAP like a Factory, Proactive Problem Management) Communications Management : Manages communications with IS and Business Community. Including, but not limited to: Planned & Unplanned Outages, Support Processes Changes, Weekly/Monthly Support Dashboard. Seeks regular feedback and interaction with region’s Key Service Stakeholders Collaborates with global teams in Dashboard definition and changes Demand Management : Oversees Change Requests Forecast for 30-60-90 days for the region. Monitors Enhancements/Project demands to anticipate potential Service Contract Scope Changes. Security & Compliance Management : Ensures/Approves adequate system access provisioning to Support team members. Ensures/promotes SOX guidelines accomplishment (Change Management) Life Cycle Management : Ensure/Approves life cycle refresh feasibility and timing. Coordinates/ Communicates life cycle outages with the business. What extra ingredients you will bring: Ability to analyze, visualize and communicate insights from our data to senior management and other stakeholders. Experience in one of the cloud platforms preferred (Azure, AWS, GCP, etc). Drive for results, Problem solving, integrity & trust, organization agility with strong business acumen. Willingness to learn new technologies and be hands on, if required to support the team Education / Certifications: University degree in related career. ITIL Foundation Certified (Preferably) Certifications in Business Intelligence Tools & technologies (Preferably) Job specific requirements: A minimum of 12 years of IT & business/industry work experience, managing cross functional teams or projects, ability to influence key stakeholders and senior leaders. At least 5 years of experience in GCP, Talend, Databricks, Dataproc, data engineering or related field. Proficiency with Programming Languages: SQL, Python for data processing 8+ Years of experience in SAP BI/HANA, Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx, IBM DataStage, Hadoop, Azure & Google Cloud Platforms, ETL’s, Microsoft Integration Services, Microsoft SQL, Microsoft Analysis & Reporting Services. Proven experience in managing large Analytic teams and Applications service intake into Operations. Experience in stakeholder management and partnering with other leaders in driving key initiatives and Data strategy. Broad knowledge in Data wrangling, Data Engineering & Data Science Strong functional background with solid understanding of CPG business along with detailed technical knowledge to generate insights from data. Demonstrates skills in analytics delivery, client relationship management, keen sense of urgency in delivering results, business knowledge, intuition and judgement, high cross-cultural awareness and sensitivity and collaboration with stake holders. Extensive experience bringing data from multiple platforms and showcase easy to understand visualizations. Skill in turning data into digital insights. Strong project management experience, demonstrated ability to manage large analytics platform applications support, concurrently delivering multiple projects within the budget successfully. Exceptional communication and presentation skills. #dice No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We ha

jobTitle: Manager, Customer Logistics
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Possible. You will support end-to-end logistics (physical flows from plants to customers), including all warehouse, transport and co-packing operations, in terms of service, cost, health and safety, quality, food defense, sustainability, legal requirements and policies compliance. You will provide team leadership and direction for the logistics organization. In this role, you will implement logistics strategy and effectively execute operations to ensure optimum logistics solutions while supporting various routes-to-market, and balancing service and cost. You will work collaboratively with internal and external (third-party logistics vendors) business partners to ensure effective management, timely solutions and execution. How You Will Contribute You will: Be accountable for warehouse, transportation, international logistics (import/export) and co-packing operations Ensure the implementation of the business plan by delivering a consistent service level, adapting the supply chain to the demanding and changing customer environment and ensuring sufficient operational capacity to deliver business needs Be accountable for delivering logistics operational cost budget, ensuring that best-in-class controls and governance are in place Foster, initiate and lead continuous improvement programs that reduce cost and our carbon footprint and improve the service performance of the operation Ensure successful project implementation Select, manage and develop long-term relationships with third-party service providers Ensure adherence to health and safety, quality, food defense and legal requirements and policies Establish a business continuity plan for logistics operations. Support best-practices sharing and adoption What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Solid background in logistics with experience leading operations in an FMCG/CPG environment Team leadership experience, with proven ability to build effective teams and develop people Drive for results with proactive, dynamic and action orientated approach, identifying areas where business change is required and excellence in project management Strong collaboration skills with strong business and financial acumen and the ability to forge senior level strategic partnerships with both internal and external stakeholders Strategic thinking plus excellent presentation, communication, influencing and motivational skills Strong negotiating skills with ability to negotiate in tough situations with both internal and external groups More About This Role Education / Certifications: Bachelors Degree Required Travel requirements: Less than 10% travel Work schedule: Normal Business Hours Within Country Relocation support available and for candidates voluntarily moving internationally some minimal support is offered through our Volunteer International Transfer Policy Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. For office-based, salaried roles at Bakery and Customer Service & Logistics locations, and some remote roles proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required to be eligible for employment. Religious, medical and/or other accommodations as required by law will be considered on a case by case basis. You may review the Mondelēz COVID vaccination policy by visiting the US careers website at https://www.mondelezinternational.com/United-States. This COVID-19 vaccine mandate does not apply to several U.S. states that do not permit certain vaccination mandates, including, but not limited to Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, Florida, Indiana, Montana, North Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, and West Virginia. jobTitle: Manager, Demand Planning-10
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Possible You will oversee demand planning activities for your assigned product families in your business unit. You will also lead the demand review process and driving interactions with the cross-functional teams. How You Will Contribute You will: Lead the demand management agenda for the category, being the key interface between commercial (sales revenue planning) and supply (replenishment) to identify and evaluate the impact of potential availability issues/commercial changes including gap assessment and risk and opportunity discussions Partner with modelling team for the generation of statistical forecasting Manage, coach and develop a team Review standard consumption versus forecast at the customer and total product levels, liaising with replenishment and sales revenue planning to manage potential availability issues and the impact of under consumption Drive strong linkages with the commercial, customer collaboration, modelling, order fulfilment teams and supply planning including innovation and equity Drive continuous capability building in the demand planning team for planning improvement What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Comprehensive supply chain, economic, financial or logistics experience and commercial awareness in a fast-moving consumer goods or consumer packaged goods environment Open to learn new ways of working and is willing to use new tools Experience driving demand review and participation in an IBP cycle Able to influence cross-functional teams, working on the key priorities and improving the plan Able to build effective teams Knowledge in leading practice demand planning and end-to-end supply chain concepts Excellent problem-solving skills, analytical skills and verbal and written communication skills What extra ingredients you will bring: Food Service Business Experience highly preferred. Demand Planning Experience preferred Education / Certifications: Bachelors Degree is required Job specific requirements: APO demand Planning (preferred) Travel requirements: less than 10% No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Religious, medical and/or other accommodations as required by law will be considered on a case by case basis. jobTitle: Manager, DSD Logistics
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Possible. You will support end-to-end logistics (physical flows from plants to customers), including all warehouse, transport and co-packing operations, in terms of service, cost, health and safety, quality, food defense, sustainability, legal requirements and policies compliance. You will provide team leadership and direction for the logistics organization. In this role, you will implement logistics strategy and effectively execute operations to ensure optimum logistics solutions while supporting various routes-to-market, and balancing service and cost. You will work collaboratively with internal and external (third-party logistics vendors) business partners to ensure effective management, timely solutions and execution. How You Will Contribute You will: Be accountable for warehouse, transportation, international logistics (import/export) and co-packing operations Ensure the implementation of the business plan by delivering a consistent service level, adapting the supply chain to the demanding and changing customer environment and ensuring sufficient operational capacity to deliver business needs Be accountable for delivering logistics operational cost budget, ensuring that best-in-class controls and governance are in place Foster, initiate and lead continuous improvement programs that reduce cost and our carbon footprint and improve the service performance of the operation Ensure successful project implementation Select, manage and develop long-term relationships with third-party service providers Ensure adherence to health and safety, quality, food defense and legal requirements and policies Establish a business continuity plan for logistics operations. Support best-practices sharing and adoption What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Solid background in logistics with experience leading operations in an FMCG/CPG environment Team leadership experience, with proven ability to build effective teams and develop people Drive for results with proactive, dynamic and action orientated approach, identifying areas where business change is required and excellence in project management Strong collaboration skills with strong business and financial acumen and the ability to forge senior level strategic partnerships with both internal and external stakeholders Strategic thinking plus excellent presentation, communication, influencing and motivational skills Strong negotiating skills with ability to negotiate in tough situations with both internal and external groups Education / Certifications: Bachelors Required Travel requirements: NA Work schedule: 8am-5 PM with ability to be adaptable as needed Within Country Relocation support available and for candidates voluntarily moving internationally some minimal support is offered through our Volunteer International Transfer Policy Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. For office-based, salaried roles at Bakery and Customer Service & Logistics locations, and some remote roles proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required to be eligible for employment. Religious, medical and/or other accommodations as required by law will be considered on a case by case basis. You may review the Mondelēz COVID vaccination policy by visiting the US careers website at https://www.mondelezinternational.com/United-States. jobTitle: Manager, Global Environmental Programs
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter. You will develop and manage global, regional or market level programs using your subject matter expertise to support of our Impact pillars of Sustainability, Mindful Snacking, and Social Impact. In this role, you will direct others (internally and externally) on the implementation of programs to grow our business. How You Will Contribute As you implement the programs, you will oversee cross-functional project teams, agencies and NGO partners, manage program budgets, create and maintain reports on program results. You will work locally with business colleagues and external partners to implement plans under each respective pillar. Main Responsobilities Lead internally the definition, reporting and communication of global environmental sustainability KPIs for manufacturing (mthly, qly, annually) Co-lead external reporting requirements of global environmental sustainability performance for MSC (Dow Jones Sustainability Index, CDP Climate & CDP 3. Water submissions for investors, Mdlz supported Consumer Goods Forum Resolutions on Refrigerants & Food Waste) Co-lead global external sustainability audit program(s) for manufacturing (e.g. AIM-Progress for ethical production, external environmental systems and reporting) Lead agreed global environmental track(s) of work to meet company sustainability goal(s) for manufacturing: e.g water, food waste, carbon net zero (scopes 1 & 2) Manage global Water CAPEX program implementation (jointly with Reg Engg & external partner) Coordinate Global RE (Renewable Electricity) agenda Support E2E environmental programs and agenda in partnership with Impact team (Net Zero Carbon (focused on scope 1 & 2), E2E Water ambitions, R&D, etc.) Transfer capabilities and support implementation and execution at Regional and BU levels (including global environmental standards) More About This Role What you need to know about this position: What extra ingredients you will bring: A desire to lead the future for our company and accelerate you career with experience and knowledge in: Leading and managing in a related industry and/or Impact area such as Sustainability, Mindful Snacking, Social Impact or Well-being Excellent program and project management skills Understanding of and passion for positive influence, external social impact and business growth under one or more of our Impact pillars Clear, effective communication skills in a variety of settings and styles Education / Certifications: Bachelor's Degree minimum in Engineering, Environmental Science or equivalent Job specific requirements: Leading global virtual team(s) of peers from different Regions/functions (>2 yrs) Experience in developing corporate environmental standards and environmental reporting (> 7yrs) Experience in developing & implementing key tools to measure & improve environmental footprint (> 5yrs) Demonstrated knowledge of key current external reporting systems/standards : Enablon, SMETA, DJSI, CDP, ISO 14000 Travel requirements: Up to 10% Within Country Relocation support available and for candidates voluntarily moving internationally some minimal support is offered through our Volunteer International Transfer Policy Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. jobTitle: Manager, Legal Ops
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter. The Manager, Legal Operations will be responsible the financial operational end-to-end processes, systems and services related to the outside counsel management globally. This position includes other responsibilities such as monitoring financial performance, legal invoice processing, reporting, and implementing improvements. Substantial interaction with IT, global users of the department’s matter management technology, procurement, Finance, and outside counsel law firms. Responsibilities: Invoice Processing Process outside counsel legal invoices. Understand direct and indirect tax implications for outside counsel legal invoices for the countries/regions that company does business Respond to law firm and vendor queries regarding invoices and payments and act as primary contact for all invoicing issues with internal colleagues Monitor and reconcile invoices between e-billing and SAP systems Monitor and audit invoices to ensure timely processing and in accordance with Outside Counsel Billing Guidelines Analyze rejections and/or deductions, resolve issues, coordinate and process revisions or adjustments Financial Reporting and Analytics Assist with internal forecasts, financial planning and potential budget risks to ensure the department meets their strategic financial targets Develop outside counsel reports for the regions and business units Support regularly scheduled monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting requirements Develop understanding of Mondelez International’s database reporting capabilities, including an understanding of the metrics Mondelez International possesses or can develop that reflect Legal spending Analyze key billing and matter data sets to perform comparative analytics and trends across functional activities and recommend process improvements to ensure efficiencies Analyze and measure the law firm’s performance against budgets, staffing models, budget and staff plans, maintain metrics scorecard and develop strategies and recommendations Work directly with Practice Leads and managing attorneys to better understand their spend, and continually improve reporting Manage the accrual process, reconciliation and communication with the firms Matter and Vendor Management Act as the primary contact for all matter management issues with internal stakeholders, law firms and vendors Oversee timekeeper management, including new timekeeper requests and approvals Ensure integration, development, continued improvement of the Global Law Department’s Matter Management and electronic billing systems, and ensure compliance with the global financial and budgeting requirements Manage law firm and vendor onboarding process to Mondelez International’s electronic billing and matter management system Other Coordinate and maintain the department’s Global Outside Counsel Management strategy processes and tools to share knowledge and procedures across the legal department Project management, development of policies and procedures, define reporting requirements, process improvements, as well as end-user training and enhance the global team’s operational effectiveness and support Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree Preferred Advanced Excel skills (i.e., Formulas, Pivot Charts, Pivot Tables, Formatting, etc.) Possess deep understanding of accounting principles and ensuring compliance with legal billing guidelines Previous finance or legal operations experience Demonstrated leadership and project management in cross-functional projects Experience with electronic billing and matter management Excellent analytical skills and comfort with multiple data sets, with the ability to draw conclusions and make informed recommendations Ability to present complex information in an accurate and persuasive manner to all levels of management Excellent written and verbal communications skills Intellectually curious with ability to process a great deal of information in a fast paced environment willing to take initiative Demonstrate integrity to manage sensitive and confidential information Must have strong client service orientation and demonstrated high level of customer focus and initiative Should have experience working with vendors, budgets and effectively manage a project from its initiation to delivery Must be a team player who can easily handle shifting priorities, multi-tasking in a deadline oriented and collaborative environment No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. For office-based, salaried roles at Bakery and Customer Service & Logistics locations, and some remote roles proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required to be eligible for employment. Religious, medical and/or other accommodations as required by law will be considered on a case by case basis. jobTitle: Manufacturing – Process Engineer Intern
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter. As an organization we are committed to developing the next generation of Makers and Bakers. Joining us at an early career stage in our fast paced and ever changing environment will enable you to do more, learn more and grow more. You will be encouraged to step outside your comfort zone– you may even surprise yourself! We will ensure you are given the support you need to be at your best and enable you to be yourself and bring passion and personality. Here you can lean in and speak up and bring your own flavor. Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Get ready to Taste The Future. As an organization we are committed to developing the next generation of Makers and Bakers. Join our Taste The Future Program; our fast paced and ever-changing environment will enable you to do more, learn more and grow more. You will be encouraged to step outside your comfort zone– you may even surprise yourself! We will ensure you are given the support you need to be at your best and enable you to be yourself and bring passion and personality. Here you can lean in and speak up and bring your own flavor. Manufacturing As part of Manufacturing, you’ll use your skills, our systems, and a wide array of raw materials to help create the delicious, finished products our consumers love. While taking ownership in your area of work, you’ll also ensure the safety of yourself and your colleagues while producing our top-quality products reliably and efficiently within our integrated supply chain. Mondelēz International Operations assignments are designed for individuals pursuing careers in Engineering and Manufacturing Production/ Operations Management. Our internship assignments focus on practical, value-added projects, and related experiences that teach how operations production drives value throughout the organization. This includes: Providing leadership and guidance to employees while optimizing production Meeting production schedules to achieve business goals Communicating effectively with managers, supervisors, and employees Leading multi-functional project teams of technical and operations functions Successful individuals will ideally be pursuing a BS in Chemical Engineering, Operations Management, Industrial/Manufacturing/Mechanical Engineering. Individuals will possess the ability to build and develop strong cross functional relationships in a fast-paced manufacturing plant. A demonstrated drive for results, ability to set and deliver upon indicated priorities and customer focus is critical to success Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. jobTitle: Materials Manager
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. The Naperville site is the sole manufacturer of Triscuit crackers. The facility is unionized and operates on a 24/7 schedule with shipments to various Distribution Centers and customers throughout the United States and Canada. This position is full time, reports directly to the plant manager and sits on the plant leadership team, working on strategic direction for the facility. Flexibility is a must. Must possess a "big picture" awareness of the business in order to meet plant and network goals, maintain safety and quality standards, and communicate effectively at all levels. You will be responsible for planning, leading, organizing and controlling of warehousing to ensure efficient inventory and warehouse management and cost-effective delivery of shipment volume objectives. You will be planning, leading, organizing and controlling the plant’s Dispensary operations for raw & packaging material to provide consistent quality ingredients to production in an efficient and cost-effective manner. The Materials Manager is responsible for driving safe work expectations and practices for all direct and indirect reports and the control and movement of all direct and indirect materials in and out of the plant. Manages the capacity planning for the facility and maintains the direct interface with the business planning team to ensure plant production capabilities are aligned with business volume requirements Facilitates scheduling of production planning and scheduling for the facility including: inventory management of raw materials, direct/ indirect supplies, labor, and finished goods Directly manages the receiving and shipping departments in the facility which include inbound materials, receiving and finished goods shipments Responsible for the Ingredient Handling portion of operations, including Autonomous Maintenance Progression Directly responsible for the management of SAP as the Enterprise Resource Planning system as well as EWM Owns the business continuity plan for the facility and supports the HSE programs for Emergency Preparedness, Respiratory Protection, and Powered Industrial Equipment Element Teams This position has three salaried direct report and is responsible for 15-20 union employees (including 2 hourly coordinators). Duties may include (but are not limited to): Manage facility production schedule to achieve optimum operating cost and labor efficiency. Ensure facility compliance to schedule targets are met or exceeded and Customer Service levels are maintained for the SKU's produced at the site Facilitate weekly schedule planning meeting with Operations and support staff. Ensure that labor is properly scheduled to meet the production demands of the facility Lead, manage and develop the workforce & activities of the Receiving and Shipping departments driving safe, efficient, sanitary operations. Establish, document & ensure training of ongoing & new procedures. Ensure methods being used will provide safe, consistent, clean materials to the plant and follow all guidelines for safety, quality & security. Ensure all quality procedures are in place and executed including GMP’s, material traceability and hold/release process Procure all raw and packaging materials for the Naperville plant. Receive incoming raw materials and monitor through the conversion process and final shipment as finished goods. Maintain supplier relationships. Resolve delivery, quality, procedural and invoice discrepancies. Communicate and issue complaints to vendor and ensure corrective action and reimbursement. Work closely with suppliers to ensure they are meeting contractual obligations while maintaining continuity of supplies to the facility to meet the changing requirements Works with Category Logistics Managers and Division Materials Manager to reduce inventory levels and increase accuracy including maintaining the BOM’s and cycle counting process. Who's the right fit: Bachelor’s Degree – Supply Chain Management, Accounting/Finance, Business Administration, Logistics, Engineering, or related field (strongly preferred) Minimum 5 years in Supply Chain and Logistics Management Excellent Leadership, Interpersonal, and Analytical skills Strong Computer (MS Office) and Communication Skills (Verbal and Written) Experience with SAP Prior experience in a fast paced unionized manufacturing environment Prior operations experience – production responsibility Prior experience implementing World Class Manufacturing tools and processes as it relates to material flow Background in LEAN manufacturing systems Prior experience with implementation of Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) principles and Lean-Six Sigma capability tools Experience with shipping inbound / outbound materials. No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. jobTitle: Mechanical Specialist - Earn additional 3K to start
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. You independently operate and maintain at least one process, equipment or systems following autonomous maintenance (AM) standards and use your technical skills to improve line and/or system performance to meet business needs. How You Will Contribute You are a key ingredient in changing how the world snacks. With coaching, you will operate and maintain equipment to deliver on our safety, quality, cost, delivery, sustainability and morale targets. You will use execute all standard work processes on your equipment using AM (autonomous maintenance) and PM (progressive maintenance) standards and ensure that safety processes are observed, and that quality assurance activities are performed. You will understand the losses in their area and equipment and report them. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in: Operating machines with coaching Safety and quality standards for operating machines Reading and writing, and fluently conversant in the language of communication as appropriate to the site Collaborating well in a diverse work environment What you need to know about this position: Prepares machinery for production (including code changes, turning on heat, test running machines, setting glue pattern, checking the mechanical malfunctions, etc.) Does all lubrication. Prepares adhesives where necessary Fabricates all parts needed for repair or modification Makes all adjustments of existing, new, or reworked parts on machinery assigned Studies machine running problems to determine if the cause is mechanical, out of spec material or personnel Maintains clean working habits, and when job is complete, will clean working areas and machines used Fills daily down time sheets for production machinery assigned Observes all safety rules, practices and procedures on performance of duties What extra ingredients you will bring: 5 years experience in Maintenance Mechanical (preferred) Machines/equipment experience Operates and uses measuring devices, hand tools and power tools Safety considerations Considerable care necessary to prevent accidents resulting in permanent disability Computer experience with work order entry, MS office Food manufacturing environment (Preferred) High Speed packaging equipment (Preferred) Machining Background (Mill, Lathe, etc.) (Preferred) Education / Certifications: GED/High School Diploma (required) Safety knowledge or certifications Work schedule: 3rd Shift. Monday - Thursday, OT with weekends off Willing to work overtime and special projects Flexibility is required Benefits: These are some of the great benefits that you will be entitled for: Life and disability insurance and Saving plan. Medical, dental and vision benefit package 401K Holidays per year. jobTitle: NA DSD/RDC Proj Mgr
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours. The Mondelēz Customer Service & Logistics (CS&L) organization is a network of (45) DSD branches & (7) regional distribution centers, driving processes alignment, ways of working, technologies, and best practices. The function will LEAD the effort in this standardization supporting key metrics resulting in a positive impact to Service and Costs through execution of CAPEX infrastructure investments. Strong cross functional teams will have to be built to succeed, including procurement, engineering, external vendors, and Finance. This role is responsible for the management, communication and stakeholder management of the projects and projects in scope. The position also develops and implements the Material Handling Equipment Strategy with Procurement and CS&L management. This individual will lead, support, INFORM, & consult cross functional teams (e.g. site evaluations, analysis, sourcing and execution in role scope) and introduce & implement best practices and / or productivity opportunities. As the Role covers many locations regular travel is required as well as Collaboration with SCR/Lean team. Main Responsibilities Lead the drive for continuous improvement, simplification (Keep it Simple value) establishing processes that drive productivity, including creating/managing & establishing Best Practices across region for Pallets, MHE & CAPEX. Manages the cross functional collaboration for all business-related issues in role scope for process and/or technology changes or implementation A Subject Matter Expert in scope of role: Collaborates with Procurement on vendor issues/changes/governance. Participates / lead role in all supplier events. Governance & process collaboration with vendors e.g Lessor process simplification in alerting & notifying MDLZ locations prior to the expiration of MHE Leases. Roll-out & ensure Best Practices are executed across MDLZ NA Operations, work with business partners to develop solutions that minimize business disruption relating to process changes & system modifications on behalf of LogOps involving pallets. Leverage external industry contacts to provide insight into new trends direct/indirect to job scope Supports, manages & reconciles the PTP process for all CAPEX related PO's (Coupa Master-Shopper) Ensures all Capex projects are closed in system & have undergone the Capitalization process (incl. 'return on investment' calc in AR) with finance. Project Manager of all NA DSD locations Develop clear SOP's monitoring & recording established KPI's. Implement required / supporting technology (where approved) e.g. Performance Tracking Tools. Key Interfaces / Stakeholders External: Crown, Enersys & Merrimak Management MDLZ External Manufacturers , 3PL Management Teams Pallet sales & rental vendors Internal: CS&L DC leads, MDLZ Procurement & Capital Finance MDLZ Manufacturing Plants, Customer Service Mgrs Qualifications: Strong Business Knowledge - MDLZ Distribution experience Project Management - Strong PM Leadership Skills Logistics/Distribution Operational Experience Strong Operations Management experience Change management role Engineering role Knowledge of MDLZ Pallet Strategy Subject matter expert in Facility Infrastructure & Material Handling Equipment What you need to know about this position: What extra ingredients you will bring: Strong Leadership Skills Action & Results Oriented Demonstrated Change Management Experience Innovative Problem Solver Self Starter & Requires Minimal Supervision Interpersonal & Communication Skills Strong Analytical Skills Education / Certifications: Bachelors Degree required Job specific requirements: Applicants must complete all required steps in the application process, including providing a Resume/CV, in order to be considered for this position. Travel requirements: 50% - 75% (+) Multiple weekends (6 – 12 depending on projects) Within Country Relocation support available and for candidates voluntarily moving internationally some minimal support is offered through our Volunteer International Transfer Policy Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint.
