jobTitle: Sales Representative Intern
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter. As an organization we are committed to developing the next generation of Makers and Bakers. Joining us at an early career stage in our fast paced and ever changing environment will enable you to do more, learn more and grow more. You will be encouraged to step outside your comfort zone– you may even surprise yourself! We will ensure you are given the support you need to be at your best and enable you to be yourself and bring passion and personality. Here you can lean in and speak up and bring your own flavor. An internship within Mondelēz International Sales & Customer Logistics organization is generally a 10-12 week assignment. The assignment, which closely mirrors experiences of a Nabisco Sales Representative, will provide a realistic preview of the Sales Representative's responsibilities and is geared towards developing knowledge of the Mondelēz International Field Sales & Customer Logistics organization. Individuals are exposed to sales (selling and merchandising), logistics, account teams, and human resources while growing the necessary skills to work independently and also function successfully as part of a team. Each intern is assigned a supervisor who designates projects, answers questions and provides guidance. Throughout the summer, the intern will be assessed on overall performance, including project management, and personal leadership skills. Primary Responsibilities Develop a knowledge of Mondelez products, sales systems and procedures including proper merchandising, sources of product and distribution, space management programs and uses, sales campaigns and promotions, sales brochures and order guides, and sales presentations. Positively influence the sale of Mondelez products by exploiting selling opportunities at the store level consistent with company programs and strategies. Maintain a timely and accurate call schedule. Secure store-level support on special promotions, seasonal items, special product bookings and new items. Meet or exceed all shelving standards and ensure inventory needs are met. Develop strong business relationships with store management. Monitor and report on competitive activity and document all pricing activities. Provide order writing support on territories for Sales Representatives absent due to vacation or other reasons. Complete administrative reporting responsibilities. Provide specific feedback to Mondelez personnel while covering a Sales Representatives territory. Professionally represent the Mondelez organization, acting in accordance with company business standards and managing financial activities in an ethical manner. Present a project on customer or industry topics to senior management at end of summer. Identify and communicate individual store problems and opportunities to the appropriate Mondelez personnel. Benefits and Compensation: This position is a paid internship, but does not offer a benefit package, bonus incentives, or company provided vehicles/ housing. Key Competencies: Learning on the Fly - Adaptable to new environments, quick learner, open to change Intellectual Horsepower – Deals with concepts and complexity comfortably, intellectually sharp, capable and agile Interpersonal Savvy – Relates well to all kinds of people, builds appropriate rapport and effective relationships Peer Relationships – Team player, cooperative, easily gains trust and support of peers, encourages collaboration Problem Solving – Looks beyond the obvious and doesn’t stop at the first answers, can see hidden problems, excellent at honest analysis Perseverance - Pursues everything with energy, drive, and a need to finish; Seldom gives up before finishing, especially in the face of resistance or setbacks Action Oriented - Enjoys working hard; Is action oriented and full of energy for the things he/she sees as challenging; Not fearful of acting with a minimum of planning; Seizes more opportunities than others Personal Learning - Picks up on the need to change personal, interpersonal, and managerial behavior quickly; Watches others for their reactions to his/her attempts to influence and perform, and adjusts; Seeks feedback Requirements: You must be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license, proof of auto insurance, and have access to the internet with a personal email account Must have a reliable vehicle, insurance and a valid driver’s license Must be currently enrolled in a post-secondary degree program A flexible work schedule is required, including being available to work weekends and holidays Previous grocery, retail, sales, and/or customer service experience a plus Must be open to performing Merchandiser responsibilities, as needed Must be willing to relocate self for this position, if not a local applicant Successful completion of drug test, MVR check, and general background check Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. jobTitle: Sales Resourcing Specialist - Southern, California
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. Sales Resourcing Specialist The Sales Resourcing Specialist (SRS) is responsible primarily, though not exclusively, for the hiring of sales merchandisers for their respective sales region. Areas of focus will include partnering with the sales recruiters to ensure they have a full understanding of the needs of the businness in regards to the positions opened - such as working hours, geographical territory for which the role will merchandise, job requirements, job duties and qualifications. This role will ensure that vacancies are prioritized according to revenue impact to ensure critical staffing levels are maintained to deliver against the needs of the business. This role will entitle recruiting efforts to attract talent, interviewing potential candidates, extending offers and closing candidate hiring processes on behalf of retail merchandising supervisors/ hiring managers. This position reports directly into the Sales Region Vice President (RVP) and plays a critical role in ensuring staffing levels are optimized and maintained while helping to support a more efficient and effective hiring process. Responsibilities: Collaborate and partner with Mondelēz International Business Services in the recruitment for Sales Service Representative positions for the sales region. Identify hard to fill areas and collaborate in finding recruitment solutions specific to difficult geographies Manage open positions for the region to ensure positions are valid needs and to prevent recruitment waste Update the RVP and Human Resources on the region recruitment status and any potential risk areas (High turnover teams, highest open position teams, identify competitive areas Interview Potential candidates, extend offers and close candidates on behalf of the hiring manager Requirements: Bachelor’s degree preferred Previous Retail / Grocery experience is a plus Willingness to travel overnight and cover different locations within the Pacific Mountain Region geographies (Company Car provided) Must reside in the Southern California Area Ability to manage multiple, sometimes conflicting priorities. Strong interpersonal, listening and assessment skills Strong follow-through and prioritization skills Initiative, self-motivation and a strong sense of urgency are essential Must be able to prioritize multiple tasks/projects while delivering results and meeting deadlines. Time management skills are critical Effective communication skills Problem solving skills Computer literate (Microsoft Office, Internet, and Cellular/Wireless devices) No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. For office-based, salaried roles at Bakery and Customer Service & Logistics locations, and some remote roles proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required to be eligible for employment. Religious, medical and/or other accommodations as required by law will be considered on a case by case basis. jobTitle: Sanitation Manager
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? We are the maker and bakers of iconic snacks like Oreo, Ritz Crackers, Chips Ahoy! and many more. Mondelēz International – Chicago Bakery is a manufacturer of biscuits and crackers. The products are produced, unitized, and stored at the facility for shipment to various Distribution Centers and customers throughout the United States and Canada. Under the direction of the Quality Manager, this position coordinates the activities of the Sanitation Department. Directs activities of hourly employees to provide effectively and cost-efficient sanitation and pest control programs. Schedules frequency of cleaning and trains in procedures to maintain the equipment at the highest level of cleanliness. Manages sanitation policies / procedures and audits written procedures against effectiveness and execution.  Serves as a technical resource and primary contact for plant personnel on sanitation and pest control issues.  Serves as liaison with Regulatory Agencies and Corporate Sanitation Auditors.  Assures plant sanitation objectives are met through coordination and communication with Operations and Maintenance. What you need to know about this position: Maintain clean and orderly plant / equipment; involves working in food manufacturing environment with high degree of noise and temperature extremes Create and update SSOPs to ensure they are effective and efficient, that they include the correct tools and approved chemicals, No. of people required for the task, the frequency required, and the approximate time of completion. Evaluate sequence of cleaning, adequacy of tools, chemicals, and frequency of cleaning activities to ensure they are adequate, keeping always an aim for continuous improvement of processes. Use knowledge of sanitation procedures to ensure all products are free of contamination through the elimination of all possible sources of infestation or unsanitary conditions Maintains internal control over supplies, ordering when necessary Develop and maintain plant master sanitation schedule Conduct plant sanitation inspections and participate in all corporate sanitation audits Supervise and coach direct reports in the performance of assigned duties Support plant metrics SQDCM, all initiatives policies, and procedures Manage the recycling program and shredding of obsolete documentation Ensure any overhead leaks are properly managed Ensure the proper procedures are being followed for changeover cleanings. Manage the non-pathogen monitoring program. Drive sanitation practices that produce safe quality products that meet regulatory and company requirements Ensure the proper escalation of pest findings is done to the corporate sanitation team in accordance to the Procedure. Work with Maintenance to ensure any pest control risk is mitigated Review any new equipment prior to installation for conformance to sanitary design requirements. Work with Engineering to improve existing equipment sanitary design. Oversee and Coach Operations Teams on SSOPs to ensure all areas are cleaned per SSOP Work within the Quality Department as a change agent for continuous improvement and sustainability of Food Safety and Quality practices. Help conduct GMP audits as part of the GMP Auditing Team Ensure all sanitation workers have the correct training, including procedure, chemical, GMP and safety training Job specific requirements: Bachelor's Degree Experience with Sanitation Systems in a Food Processing Plant (required) Prior experience managing Direct Reports and Sanitation Programs (required) Experience with SAP (preferred) Strong Continuous Improvement mindset (required) Strong Computer (MS Office) and Communication skills (Oral and Written) Excellent Time Management, Prioritization and Organizational Skills Flexibility is required: able to work weekends and off-hours as needed to ensure team’s capabilities No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. jobTitle: Scientist
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. Working as part of a cross functional team, you deliver the RDQ activities required to complete new product development, portfolio maintenance and/or productivity projects with an emphasis on meeting the desired consumer experience. How You Will Contribute With the support and guidance of a manager, you will organize and execute projects in line with RDQ, marketing and manufacturing requirements, effectively communicating status and risks. You will plan and conduct pilot plant and factory trials in accordance with good manufacturing practice and HACCP requirements and development activities (e.g. product shelf-life testing, designing for quality, consumer test preparation etc.). You will also write technical reports that will require the analysis and interpretation of results and that lead to conclusions and recommendations and create and maintain accurate consumer-led specifications. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Food science, science, or engineering ideally in a fast-moving consumer goods market Working on teams and independently with the guidance of a manager Prioritizing and managing activities Identifying problems proactively and creating and implementing solutions independently Applying fundamental technical understanding to interpret and analyze data to reach clear conclusions Communicating effectively verbally and in writing, including technical writing Putting the consumer at the heart of development activities More About This Role Education: Bachelor´s degree in Food Science or relative. (Required) Experience: 4 years of experience in the Food Industry. (Required) flexibility to travel to Mexico, Canada and within USA. (Required) A person to have done product development. (Preferred) No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Scientist II - Rheology & Physical Sciences
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. You plan and execute experiments and apply your fundamental understanding to analysis of results. You also plan and implement projects, taking corrective measures when necessary and communicate effectively with others in your functional area and across the organization globally. How You Will Contribute You will be responsible for performing a range of analyses to ensure that projects are completed effectively, and time, and which meet customers’ expectations. Under supervision, you will set up new analytical methods using existing technology and instruments and plan and implement new experiments, providing data for validation. To succeed in this role, you will use your strong teamwork skills to collaborate with others to perform analyses and report work in accordance with analytical standards, ensure effective organization of your assigned workload, and assess the integrity and accuracy of the analytical data generated. Maintaining a clean, tidy and safe working environment is crucial in your role, so you will use the laboratory’s best practices in your work. You will use your knowledge of generic and specific software packages (such as analytical instruments and statistics) and deliver technical reports and presentations to internal groups. In addition, you will train and mentor junior team members in analysis and laboratory programs and provide administrative support for laboratory management. What You Will Bring Good understanding of relevant laboratory equipment and techniques (theory and practice) and is able to provide basic maintenance Accountability to deliver the analytical scope of the projects Flexible and adaptable to meet customer/business requirements Meticulous attention to detail and an ability to follow written instructions Good Communication skills and able to develop good working relationships with others Self motivated, enthusiastic and quick to learn Scientific understanding and ability to conduct chemical analysis in relevant areas under supervision More About This Role The Global Analytical Sciences organization at Mondelēz International is Customer Focused, Science Led, and Results Driven providing analytical-based scientific solutions to deliver business impact. The Physical Scientist Rheology (Scientist II) role provides an excellent opportunity to build and apply fundamental physical science & property understanding of ingredients, formulations, processes and products to a wide range of leading food products and related food systems in a fast-paced rewarding environment to all categories of Mondelez. The position plans and executes experiments, delivers results, interpretation, and technical reports. At the organizational level, the position develops strong relationships within function and cross-functionally. Acts as a technological resource or as an expert in own technical scientific area. Key responsibilities include the following: Apply & build a strong physical science and engineering knowledge to lead and/or support R&D projects for a broad range of food systems across Mondelez categories Develop technical strategy, aligned with the broader Mondelēz business strategy, and initiate and lead programs and projects that create and/or import new tools & technologies to solve the biggest & most complex business-critical technical problems Apply current and develop new and innovative rheology and materials science approaches and understanding to solve practical problems Develop and apply a broad physical characterization expertise based on high quality science Develop and apply engineering and scientific expertise to drive food system ingredient, formulation and process understanding, innovation and technology, and to build computational fluid dynamics and data science models Collaborate across R&D as a cross-functional team member and develop & demonstrate technical leadership Manage projects and team relationships to deliver results in a timely manner for maximum business impact Effectively and impactful communication of technical findings to project team and management; maintain lab notebook, write technical reports and present project summaries Build, maintain and leverage strong internal and external network of technical experts Qualifications: Highly motivated MS or PhD in Engineering or Sciences with a strong, proven expertise in rheology and physical sciences 2+ years of experience in application of rheology (required) Strong experimental skills, with hands-on experience with state-of-the-art rheometers, Viscometers Skilled in building Data Science models, with knowledge of programming and using Python and R, and building Machine Learning models Experienced in leveraging strong fundamental rheological and materials science knowledge to design & interpret rheological measurements to guide formulations (such as the role of one or more ingredients on process and final product properties), processes and final products Preferably a strong understanding of what is possible applying physical sciences to build data science models Demonstrated in-depth understanding in two or more of the following areas: Polymer Science, Suspension/Colloid/Emulsion Sciences, Physical Chemistry & Process Engineering Skilled at applying theoretical and experimental knowledge to solve practical problems Ability to learn quickly, with a passion to apply multi-disciplinary background in Food Industry Excellent interpersonal & project management skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to build strong customer/client relationships No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. jobTitle: Senior Associate Brand Management Intern
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter. As an organization we are committed to developing the next generation of Makers and Bakers. Joining us at an early career stage in our fast paced and ever changing environment will enable you to do more, learn more and grow more. You will be encouraged to step outside your comfort zone– you may even surprise yourself! We will ensure you are given the support you need to be at your best and enable you to be yourself and bring passion and personality. Here you can lean in and speak up and bring your own flavor. Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Get ready to Taste The Future. As an organization we are committed to developing the next generation of Makers and Bakers. Join our Taste The Future Program; our fast paced and ever-changing environment will enable you to do more, learn more and grow more. You will be encouraged to step outside your comfort zone– you may even surprise yourself! We will ensure you are given the support you need to be at your best and enable you to be yourself and bring passion and personality. Here you can lean in and speak up and bring your own flavor. As a Sr. Associate Brand Manager Summer Intern in Marketing, you’ll be the one who first captures our consumers’ imaginations, giving them a tantalizing taste of our brands. You’ll work to help our brands stay relevant to consumers by developing and activating brand plans that capture their imagination, passion, and loyalty. During the summer internship, you will be a valued member of a brand team, providing strategic support and contributing to a Brand's success. Your experiences will include leading cross-functional teams in the planning, execution, and analysis of different aspects of the business. Your responsibilities will closely mirror those of a Sr. Associate Brand Manager and may include: Leading, analyzing and supporting delivery of business plan while managing P&L and actively participating in the Integrated Business Planning process Brand portfolio management, supporting launch plans, including innovation, renovation, commercialization, etc. Supporting the development of strategy, managing content, and working across agencies to ensure consistency of brand voice Conducting a thorough analysis of a competitive brand Assisting in the launch of a new product, including the development of the promotion plan and sales materials Developing new package design Qualifications and Requirements Include: Strategic thinking and problem-solving capabilities including strong business acumen Idea and team leadership with a consumer centric focus Analytic and creative thinking skills Ability to work with cross functional teams and successfully manage ambiguity in a fast- paced environment Strong communication and interpersonal skills Bachelor’s degree and 3-5 years’ work experience 1st year MBA program completion is required upon beginning internship Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Senior Associate Principal Engineer, Rigid Material Expert
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. In this leadership role, you serve as a senior technical resource for the organization, regularly interacting with other senior managers. You are an internally recognized expert in packaging development and packaging engineering. In this role, you identify, define and solve complex business problems by applying broad technical and consumer knowledge as well as an in-depth understanding of packaging technologies related to Mondelēz products. How You Will Contribute You will lead packaging projects or teams to design, develop, optimize and specify materials that deliver consumer benefit through new products, quality improvements and cost-savings opportunities. To do so, you apply industry-leading technologies and tools and leverage supplier relationships while effectively managing intellectual property rights. To excel in this position, you will deliver solutions on time and on budget using project management methodologies and providing status updates to stakeholders. You will also provide technical leadership for packaging development and packaging technologies by: continually updating your business-relevant expertise; driving the technical development of people by teaching, coaching, mentoring and identifying future technical leaders; defining and sharing technical best practices, and; influencing the technical direction of the business. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Executing bench-top, pilot-scale and plant-scale packaging development and engineering activities and commercialization Project management that is action orientated with the demonstrated ability to handle multiple, complex projects, prioritize, and manage budgets, risk and timelines Manufacturing operations Thinking and working globally, with a strong curiosity to look outside for new ideas and solutions Packaging and demonstrating an understanding of statistical, modeling and simulation tools Leading technical teams and talent to deliver innovations and renovations Influencing the technical direction of the business to deliver benefit using organizational awareness and clear communication More About This Role What you need to know about this position: Leverage consumer insights and category packaging strategies to lead the rigid technical platform global agenda Explore emerging technologies in rigid packaging and establish partnerships to develop technology critical to the success of the company vision. Build strong cross functional partnerships with R&D, Quality, Manufacturing and Procurement acting as a senior member of the global packaging team Provide coaching and guidance to ensure technical rigor through development and commercialization, including robust material specifications, intellectual property strategies and adherence to compliance policies and government regulations Act as the technical advisor for rigid packaging materials for the Global Packaging Leadership Team What extra ingredients you will bring: Strong knowledge base in package characterization including opening strength, top load strength, box drop testing, MVTR, OTR. Successful track record in project management Demonstrated thought leadership and drive for results Demonstrated contributions to advance sustainability, quality, and productivity agendas (short and long term) Education / Certifications: BS/MS/PhD in Material Science, Chemical Engineering, or similar degree Job specific requirements: 8 years + experience in polymers, polymer chemistry and application for rigid materials, as well as an understanding of polymer mechanical analysis, thermal analysis, and spectroscopic analysis. 5 years + experience in methods of making for rigid packaging, inclusive of thermoforming and blow molding (injection and extrusion). Ability to lead multi-functional and multi-cultural project teams; An affinity for innovation and resiliency in the face of challenges Ability to coach and inspire junior developers in packaging community Travel requirements: 20% travel required Within Country Relocation support available and for candidates voluntarily moving internationally some minimal support is offered through our Volunteer International Transfer Policy Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Senior Finance Manager, Supply Chain Finance (Transportation and Warehousing)
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours. You will manage the overall financial integrity and performance of US Transportation & Warehousing. You will help directors prepare business proposals, verify assumptions, check for daily execution and support delivery of the business unit or region objectives, ensuring the integrity and timeliness of reporting. You will also manage a Finance team and may manage a third-party team. How You Will Contribute You will: Manage aspects of finance planning and performance management process and related financial decisions potentially including strategic plan and annual contract planning/forecasting, target development, financial performance reporting/analysis, financial modeling and decision support for a focused scope within a region, business unit, country, Supply Chain, Mondelēz International Business Services or Corporate Finance team. You will own data integrity for managed scope. Contribute to a strong controls and compliance environment at Mondelēz International. You will also ensure that policies are understood in the organization and that proper controls and compliance are in place. Partner with the business providing critical financial data and insights to enable directors and wider business perspectives for strategy and decisions. Drive for harmonization, efficiencies and improvements to ways of working and build a mindset of continuous improvement within the Finance team. Build a high-performing Finance team. You will also recruit and develop Finance talent and drive our Finance talent agenda. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in: TECHNICAL EXPERTISE in financial planning and performance management including data structuring/validation, analyzing, planning and reporting company financial performance across all financial KPIs and strategy development, investment decisions and cost management to achieve financial targets. BUSINESS ACUMEN and understanding of our business, consumer packaged goods industry, and local snacking market dynamics. Relevant experience in a regional business. LEADERSHIP SKILLS including experiences with business partnering and communication across a large regional (or global), public company; experience of working as a finance leader managing a wider finance team and support/act as business to make decisions and drive execution to deliver results. GROWTH/DIGITAL MINDSET and the ability to identify opportunities and leverage technology to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness. INTEGRITY and sound judgement in all decisions and interactions aligned with our values and policies and external regulations. More About This Role The Senior Finance Manager, Supply Chain Finance (Transportation and Warehousing) will be the business partner for the US transportation and warehousing team, assuming all responsibilities from annual forecast planning to the reporting of financial performance, providing decision support for projects and initiatives and managing the relationships with various business partners. Key responsibilities: Finance business partner for the US transportation and warehousing team Lead annual forecasting process as well as forecast updates and manage monthly and quarterly financial performance tracking and reporting for the corresponding P&L lines Contribute to a strong controls and compliance environment at Mondelēz International Manage and develop your team, including third-party team members Manage special projects affecting the Mondelēz Supply Chain Develop and improve standard processes where applicable, enabling harmonization and efficiencies Qualifications: Bachelor of Science and/or Business degree in Accounting or Finance, MBA/CPA preferred Minimum of 10 or more years of experience in Finance Supply chain experience is strongly preferred Extremely systems savvy with exceptional Excel skills Outstanding analytical mindset with a desire to find the hidden opportunities for cost savings Strong business acumen, experience with business analysis, financial reporting, project management Outstanding leadership skills and experience Strong team player who manages collaboratively with all stakeholders Strong influencing and communication skills, and ability to lead informal teams Ability to manage tight deadlines and work under pressure, managing multiple and changing priorities Ability to communicate analysis in a clear, succinct and persuasive manner to all levels of the organization Ability to effectively work under pressure, managing multiple and changing priorities High level of motivation and energy with desire to ‘roll up sleeves’ moving from the high level to the detail, as necessary High level of proven analytical ability to mine data, “connect the dots” and translate data into actionable steps to drive improved business performance No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Senior HR Manager, M&A Organizational Design
jobDescription: Job Description How you will contribute You will lead across 3 key areas (listed below) partnering with all functional groups (i.e., Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, HR, Finance, etc.) and their respective HR Business Partners both at Mondelēz and the acquired businesses: Organization Design: Drive the overall organization process to design the future organization across all functional areas as we integrate our acquired businesses into MDLZ. Talent Placement: Manage the overall talent placement process, ensuring a fair selection process that places the right people in the right roles at the right time. Workforce Transition: Support identification of workforce transition needs, i.e., communicating new ways of working, changes in responsibility, need for upskilling/reskilling talent etc. in line with future role requirements. Additionally, you will support across the following areas partnering with others on the Integration Management Office: Talent Engagement/Retention: Ensure talent retention & engagement throughout the integration process, in partnership with the Culture/Change/Communications workstream, as well as assimilating talent from acquired businesses into the MDLZ organization. Overheads Tracking: Track overhead costs and realization of value creation opportunities in partnership with Finance. Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree preferred in Business Administration, Human Resources or related field 10 or more years of HR functional experience, including at least 4 years of organizational design experience Strong business acumen and leadership in HR, specifically leading organization design / talent placement in the context of large business transformations Prior post-merger integration experience is highly desirable Prior CPG experience and management consulting experience (e.g., Big 4) is valuable (but not essential) Comfort with and enjoyment of working in a rapid fast-paced environment, leading change and complex transformation Ability to develop strong partnerships with partner senior function and HR leaders Future focused, thinking ahead and anticipating risks and opportunities No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Senior Manager, Corporate Development
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours. You will help evaluate acquisitions, partnerships, alliances, joint ventures and start-ups in current and new business. You will be a part of the transaction team and support the valuation of new business opportunities. How You Will Contribute You will: Participate in aspects of transaction execution including project management, due diligence and valuation, working closely with business teams, internal functional experts (e.g. legal, accounting, tax, etc.), and outside advisors to support execution. Lead the creation of the commercial and financial business case including: Developing financial projections for M&A opportunities Collaborating with business unit leaders and functional experts to create these business propositions and ensuring that they reflect the overall strategic evaluation. Using these projections to perform detailed financial analysis; building comprehensive pro-forma financial models, valuation and sensitivity analysis and synergy models in support of potential transactions. Support our global M&A priorities as a member of a small team that influences long-term, company-wide investment initiatives. You will collaborate across the company to help assess and prioritize M&A transactions to best align with corporate strategy and growth objectives. Create and deliver high-quality presentation materials and recommendations to senior leaders and decision makers. Invest in your own personal growth and development including growing your knowledge of the industry and business. You will also collaborate with and help develop peers. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in: TECHNICAL EXPERTISE: Experience at an investment bank, private equity, venture capital or corporate development group. Strong quantitative and analytic skills. Advanced modeling skills with the ability to work with others in complex tasks and review work products. Ability to synthesize data into meaningful conclusions and recommendations. Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities with aggressive timelines. BUSINESS ACUMEN: Broad financial acumen including a strong foundation in accounting and corporate finance principles (comprehensive understanding of valuation methodologies). Desire to learn about the dynamics and trends of the global food industry. Intellectual curiosity and passion to build a best-of-class M&A brand. LEADERSHIP SKILLS: Comfortable performing in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, managing internal and external resources. Flexibility to manage projects across time zones and adapt certain approaches to different cultures and working styles. GROWTH/DIGITAL MINDSET: Willingness to challenge assumptions and the status quo to help establish best practices and leading M&A capabilities as a team. INTEGRITY: Integrity and sound judgement in all decisions and interactions aligned with our values, policies and external regulations. BA/BS with top-tier academic background. 5+ years of experience at an investment bank, private equity, venture capital or corporate development group; MBA a plus Strong quantitative and analytic skills. Advanced modeling skills, with ability to work with others in complex tasks and review work products. Ability to synthesize data into meaningful conclusions and recommendations Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities given aggressive timelines; comfortable performing in a fast paced, dynamic environment, managing both internal and external resources; flexibility to manage projects across time zones and adapt certain approaches to different cultures and working styles Broad financial acumen including a strong foundation in accounting and corporate finance principles (comprehensive understanding of valuation methodologies) Within Country Relocation support available and for candidates voluntarily moving internationally some minimal support is offered through our Volunteer International Transfer Policy Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Senior Manager, Corporate Quality Assurance
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. The Sr. Manager, US Network Manufacturing position provides leadership and management of the Sr. Manager, US Network Manufacturing position organization in ensuring Food Safety & Regulatory Compliance of internal and /or external manufacturing plants. This position is responsible for leadership in the areas of quality manufacturing strategic direction, development of manufacturing quality personnel, Food Safety and Quality Systems, product standards and Regulatory Compliance. This position drives quality commitment at the plant level to assure achievement of superior customer satisfaction, consistency, value and food safety. This position has responsibility for 2-5 direct reports, with indirect reports at internal and external manufacturing facilities. This position ideally requires experience with Snacks or Confections quality and/or manufacturing, understanding of Quality & Business Systems and the ability to influence stakeholders This position would report to the US network Director and indirectly report to the operations leader of internal and/or external manufacturing. Success in this role will require strong leadership, managing a remote team, working well with others, deep knowledge of quality principles / programs, strong technical skill, strong influencing skills, and a sound understanding of the commercial business How You Will Contribute You will lead regional and sub-regional teams to deliver on the quality strategy, providing sufficient resources and expertise to appropriate functions and locations. You will manage, lead, coach and develop a team of quality experts to execute regional and global quality programs, ensuring compliance with Mondelēz policies and procedures and adherence to external regional and local food safety/regulatory requirements in internal and external manufacturing locations and facilities. In this role, you will develop and report quality KPIs, applying your understanding of the impact regional KPIs have on the global business. In addition, you will facilitate communities of practice on quality related topics; represent the quality function at R&D meetings to ensure that sufficient resources and expertise are allocated to significant projects, and to ensure there are sufficient resources available so products meet design, food safety and quality policy requirements; identify quality enhancements and improvements across R&D and the supply chain; partner with technical groups such as food safety/micro and sanitation to ensure program compliance and enhancement, and; help manage special situations and early warnings with respect to plant investigations, root-cause analysis and follow-up for the SSMT, protecting Mondelēz’s interests and reputation. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Relevant experience in operations, quality and/or R&D Project management and managing multiple priorities Understanding of the commercial strategy process, product/package development process, food safety, plant commercialization, ingredient and package technology, coaching, and training in technical material Communication skills and leading cross-functional teams Statistical processes and problem-solving techniques Working with third-party manufacturers and suppliers to ensure compliance to Mondelēz International’s policies and procedures Working with customers on quality related issues Working with service-vendors’ technical equipment to support compliance More About This Role What extra ingredients you will bring: Influence Senior Operations & RDQ Management and lead the development and implementation of a manufacturing quality strategic plan that sets a strong Quality direction for the Manufacturing network. Deliver continuous improvement across manufacturing network through new tools / application, network benchmarking and leveraging cross-category, cross-region collaboration to ensure product design processes and quality systems are best in class. Drive the successful implementation of quality policies, programs, tools and technologies that position Quality as a competitive advantage. Leverage shared services to enable achievement of manufacturing goals. Ensure preparedness for internal and 3rd party audits. Work with plant quality managers to develop the plant Quality departments and capabilities. Provide necessary training and development in product knowledge, process technology, process control, optimization techniques, QP’s and Mondelez competencies to increase employee effectiveness and achieve optimum performance levels. Ensure direct staff is properly trained, focused and viewed as exceptional partners to the plants and external manufacturers. Manage direct reports in providing audit support to sites and facilitates in corrective/preventive action plans. Work with facilitates to ensure achievement of certification for 3rd party program, FSSC. Education / Certifications: B.S./M.S. in a related scientific discipline Job specific requirements: Minimum 8-10 years of related experience (Operations and/or RDQ) with demonstrated technical and managerial ability. Excellent leadership capabilities, interpersonal relations skills and problem solving skills. Extensive knowledge of Quality Principles and Mondelez Quality programs and Policies. Demonstrated ability to work with all levels of the organization within corporate and manufacturing settings. Travel requirements: 40% Travel Work schedule: No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance. For office-based, salaried roles at Bakery and Customer Service & Logistics locations, and some remote roles proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required to be eligible for employment. Religious, medical and/or other accommodations as required by law will be considered on a case by case basis. You may review the Mondelēz COVID vaccination policy by visiting the US careers website at https://www.mondelezinternational.com/United-States. This COVID-19 vaccine mandate does not apply to several U.S. states that do not permit certain vaccination mandates, including, but not limited to Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, Florida, Indiana, Montana, North Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, and West Virginia. jobTitle: Senior Manager ESG Reporting
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter. As a Senior Manager in the Global Sustainable Impact team this role will support the advancement of MDLZ's ESG Reporting and disclosure capabilities. The role will report into the VP Global Sustainable Packaging, ESG Reporting and Engagement. This role will lead the voluntary disclosure strategy and programs working with the ESG Team and across functions to evaluate, analyze and advance both our internal and external ESG reporting. The ideal candidate will have a passion for sustainability. Main Responsibilities: Voluntary Disclosure and reporting Management: Annual refresh and execution of the holistic ESG Reporting Strategy Coordination of information required for voluntary disclosure purposes Finalize and activate new data and standard assurance strategy, and manage cadence Assessment of new reporting frameworks and standards e.g., ISSB, GRI, and development of MDLZ disclosure strategy and roadmap Understanding and reviewing the external reporting landscape, changes to regulatory requirements at a global and local level and implications/opportunities for MDLZ Support ESG Materiality Assessment and integration into ERM Program Identify reporting opportunities (raters and rankers) and coordinate cross functional actions to enhance Advancement of internal ESG reporting including: Overseeing the implementation and advancement of ESG reporting dashboards including coordination of inputs, design and final deliverables ensuring continual engagement of key stakeholders and usage Working with External Coms, Corporate Governance, Internal Audit & Controls, Tech, and Investor Relations to ensure proactive management of ESG reporting requirements and ongoing stakeholder engagement Identifying and coordinating the reporting requirements/inputs from internal workstream leads and ensure timely population of key reports and disclosures Qualifications: BA/BS with top tier academic background Demonstrated sound, well-structured and excellent analytical capabilities Clear and concise communicator both written and in presentation form Experience in similar role or familiarity with Sustainability and/or ESG Voluntary Reporting such as CDP, DJSI, MSCI, ISS ESG, Sustainalytics, WBA, etc. either in comparable company or relevant consulting firm a bonus Familiar with sustainability standards and frameworks such as GRI, SASB, TCFD, CDP, ISSB Knowledge of the globally as well as evolving ESG regulatory reporting landscape is a plus Ability to combine strategic vision and thinking with everyday tactical detail with a strong orientation to action Effective inter-personal skills, relationship-builder who is collaborations-oriented and can effectively link the interests of multiple stakeholders Strong Project management skills Proven ability to adjust and work across-cultures Strong driver of change and demonstrated learning agility Within Country Relocation support available and for candidates voluntarily moving internationally some minimal support is offered through our Volunteer International Transfer Policy Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Senior Project Engineer
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. To support growth, world-class manufacturing and productivity, you manage the detailed planning, development and execution of capital projects, leading technical development, feasibility perspectives on engineering-related activities within the supply chain, and capital expense project execution meeting the highest levels of quality, safety and environmental requirements. You follow Mondelēz business and innovation processes in project management and ensure adherence to Mondelēz standards in execution. How You Will Contribute Working with key stakeholders, you will define and deliver the capital and technical agenda during the development phase of mid to large capital investment projects so that accurate budgets, plans and fit-for-purpose technical solutions are provided. You will develop the capital budget according to the contract and forecast cash flow. In addition, you will ensure that engineering developments and standards are implemented and develop and implement state-of-the-art processes and equipment strategies to optimize resources, harmonize assets and rollout best practices. jobTitle: Senior Supply Chain Excellence Leader
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. You will lead the full coordination and governance over the TPM based transformation strategy in the Bakery, across all disciplines, supporting work process development and delivery of the key performance targets (SQCDSM) in safety, quality, productivity, volumes, cost, sustainability, and organizational morale. You will directly support the Leadership Pillar and lead the Hoshin and Productivity Cycle work processes. You will be responsible for the development of the Associate IL6S Manager and career progression. You will ensure our manufacturing strategy is implemented and is fully effective, while striving to build a high performing organization at all levels. You will: Manage and synchronize physical as well as cultural transformation among the Operating teams in the implementation of TPM based journey, FoF-Factory of Future Line centric organization & roles (AM-Autonomous Maintenance, PM-Progressive Maintenance and an integrated 6-star model within operating Line teams) to progress into self-sufficient teams. Role models values and principles through effective coaching, mentoring and development of the team. Support the Manufacturing annual operational plans and targets to meet Safety, Quality, Cost, Delivery, Sustainability, Engagement goals in line with the site compelling business need. Coach Line Leaders, cascade & communicate the plans and targets to employees to ensure alignment and understanding around priorities, focus and KPI’s. Lead and be Accountable to establish a strong Governance to Review, Control Operational performance and Continuous Improvement plan and embed a zero-loss mindset to constantly improve and deliver against best in class both internally and externally. Drive the Operating team to identify and manage improvements to technology, culture, capability and operating systems to deliver a best practice and reliable operation. Support all Manufacturing standards, Governance, Compliance requirements (e.g. Corporate Quality, Food safety & GMP, Health, Safety, Security, Environment, Sustainability, Code of conduct, Policies & principles, Operational standards, Local legal requirements, Internal Audit norms, & other procedures updated from time to time) are in place, understood by all, and is regularly reviewed and monitored for effective implementation. Lead and be Accountable for Talent, Capabilities & Engagement for the Manufacturing team - identify and implement critical levers to attract, retain & develop critical talent and builds capability at all levels, technical and behavioral, to build a sustainable workforce profile for the future. Partner effectively with all multi-functional peers internally & externally (outside the plant) to achieve objectives, goals and KPI’s. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Strong operational & manufacturing leadership experience in CPG industry with experience in TPM-Total productive maintenance, 5s, FI, LEAN, 6 sigma tools, IIM, PMI and concepts. Excellent communication (verbal & written), organization, coaching, and leadership skills in a team-based environment. Strong demonstration of abilities in Data Analytics, problem solving and team building concepts and skills. A technical background with strong financial & business acumen, project management skills and Knowledge of industrial maintenance and manufacturing equipment. Managerial Courage – takes a position and stands by it; provides direct, actionable feedback; is not afraid to take negative action when necessary Dealing with Ambiguity – can comfortably handle risk and uncertainty; doesn’t get upset when things are up in the air; deals effectively with change and shifts gears appropriately Interpersonal Savvy – Relates well to all kinds of people in organization; builds and leverages relationships; can diffuse high-tension situations effectively Perseverance – pursues tasks with energy, drive and need to finish; does not give up until task is complete Strategic savvy – articulate today and future plans to drive business stability and transformation What you need to know about this position: Will require strong background in Continuous Improvement, Work Process Development, engineering principals, Focused Improvement and Strategic Influencing Leadership skills. TPM & AM Knowledge required. What extra ingredients you will bring: Well-developed organizational skills and strong governance and people development skills Education / Certifications: BS or equivalent. Engineering or technical related background Job specific requirements: Multi discipline and direct people leadership experience in a manufacturing environment Work schedule: M-F standard schedule with occasional exposure to all shifts and weekends. This position is located in our Chicago Bakery | 7300 S Kedzie Avenue, Chicago IL, 60629. No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Senior Talent Acquisition Lead, Manufacturing & Supply Chain
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter. As the Senior Talent Acquisition Lead, Manufacturing & Supply Chain, you will manage the in-house operations in the Mondelēz International Business Services Center to ensure impeccable service delivery that satisfies service level agreements and meets productivity and efficiency targets, emphasizing timely, accurate and complete transaction handling and excellent customer care. How You Will Contribute You will manage the employee services community in the service center and onshore and manage the relationships between delivery teams and internal customers. To excel in this role, you will report on service-center performance and lead reviews with the functional leadership team and key stakeholders. In addition, you will contribute to global service management agenda and integrate our global scale using simplified and standardized processes and technologies. As part of this job, you will oversee the employee services center’s annual budget; handle local change requests and follow the global employee services governance framework to keep local documentation updated and compliant; manage suppliers delivering services for the processes; and identify service improvements to continuously improve the quality of the service provided. As a people leader, you will train employees and lead, coach, motivate and inspire direct reports to deliver the employee services agenda. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in: Managing people and relating well with all center colleagues Being a team player with demonstrated excellence in communication, interpersonal, and customer service skills Managing a shared service or BPO delivery center regionally in a global organization Managing vendor relationships Project management with experience managing large-scale projects Data analysis with a focus on accuracy and attention to detail Multi-tasking, problem solving and managing fluctuating workloads Building relationships, motivating, educating, and mentoring Taking initiative As a key member of the Talent Acquisition (TA) team, the Senior Talent Acquisition Lead, Manufacturing & Supply Chain will be responsible for recruiting oversight of Manufacturing and Supply Chain. Bachelor’s degree is required; Master’s degree is preferred A minimum of 10 or more years of experience in TA, preferably with global responsibility Manufacturing & Supply Chain (Plant / Distribution) experience is required At least five or more years of leadership and people management experience is required Must have strong communication, partnership, teamwork, and influencing skills Exceptional and effective partnership across broad audiences of internal and external partners, stakeholders, and customers Ability to drive strategy; work with data and analytics, and demonstrated capability in effective and creative recruiting strategies Solid business acumen, systems and critical problem-solving skills Experience with Workday is a plus No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Shift Leader
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? We are the creators of Oreo, Ritz Crackers, Triscuit, Sour Patch and Swedish Fish to name a few. Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It with Pride. As a Shift Leader, you will see leadership and management experience combine with the development of deep technical mastery of process and equipment. The expertise gained in this role will allow you to manage the people, planning, process development and implementation of Planned Maintenance in a Continuous Improvement manufacturing environment. You will manage this through teams consisting of various technical and non-technical personnel, key support contractors and operations personnel. How You Will Contribute Partner & Enable the line leader(s) to deliver the SQCDSM targets-Safety, Quality, Cost, Delivery, Sustainability & Morale for the production lines, to ensure Process stability; Participate and Own DMS- Daily Management systems meetings at the shift and line level Own the technology, process and centerline settings for the equipment; Own the AM-Autonomous maintenance and PM-Progressive maintenance systems and work processes. Control Key Performance Indicators for the line/s along with CIL and Abnormality Handling Systems; owns the R&M-Repairs & Maintenance budget of the line Develop, own and execute the line/s preventive and time-based maintenance systems and plans and build capability of the team to execute themselves; Build (spends at least 50% of time) technical and maintenance skills of the core team working in the shifts, so that they are able to operate and maintain their equipment themselves; be versed in the PM Pillar, own PM systems and work process at the line level and lead some of them at the department level Partner with the Asset and Reliability team for system improvement and execution of special maintenance tasks; be responsible for Change Management on the line/s What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: The capability to lead a shift and key work process for the Line. Qualify and coach the next level Standard Work Process owners and drive the common opportunity areas across the line in PDCA-Plan Do Check Adjust approach The capability to learn from and support the Line Leader Role, developing and aligning goal/master plan for the line, deploying, and managing development plans for the core team members, coaching team members on their performance management and career development Eventual Advanced knowledge (including AM-Autonomous Maintenance Step 3 systems & Progressive Maintenance Step 2) & skill to maintain the dedicated equipment(s)at basic conditions independently, including the execution of AM & PM (BD-Breakdown maintenance, planned maintenance) standards on dedicated equipment(s) and TPM solving tools More About This Role Education / Certifications: High School Required Bachelors preferred Work schedule: Monday – Friday Weekend Coverage 2x Per Month No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. jobTitle: Sourcing Manager External Manufacturing NA
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our mission to change the way the world snacks. Make It Matter. You support sourcing for spend categories-including sourcing execution and stakeholder management-to maximize the total value of ownership for the organization. You also work closely with local business and global spend category teams to ensure best practice sharing and driving value for the organization. How You Will Contribute You will take the lead in creating value through innovation, sustainability, risk management, quality, service, cash and productivity programs all while ensuring compliance with policies, strategies and processes. In addition, you will lead in the development and deployment of sourcing strategies and the ongoing management of supplier relationships, manage the supply base working internal and external stakeholders to ensure Mondelēz International’s competitive advantage, completely build a program with the business and suppliers that incorporates best practices, market insights, risks and opportunities, and set a clear vision for various areas, defining and delivering ambitious plans that encourage teams and stakeholders to engage not just in the destination, but also in the journey. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in: Procurement experience across different market Demonstrating a future-focused mindset, showing curiosity about industry trends, digital solutions and innovation for consumers and translating opportunities into business strategies Strategic sourcing and risk management Business and financials and an understanding of how procurement brings financial value to the overall profit and loss Leading and developing teams in a multi-cultural environment Organizational agility, influencing stakeholders and interacting effectively with senior leaders based on a deep understanding of business priorities Modelling trust, integrity and perseverance Main Responsabilities More about this role Spend Area strategy execution: Support Sourcing strategy development and deployment – aligned with stakeholders. Work close with BD/PCM to lead innovation projects in a collaborative model with external manufacturers and suppliers. Lead market screening process to identify new players locally or regionally. Prepare and lead required bids and negotiations with suppliers. Identify opportunities to improve the productivity pipeline agenda in the short and long term. Manage the Supplier relationship and risk management Support supplier development activities, and set up-up cross-functional review meetings with suppliers in order to launch new products, improve performance and further reduce cost. Proactively identify supply continuity risks and develop mitigation plans. Contracting supplier process management. Partner with Supplier Development & Quality Engineering resources to ensure compliance to processes, procedures, ISO practices and regulatory/Food Safety requirements. Contribute to material cost reduction goals and implementation of the Protect the Customer process with Global Quality. Manage critical supplier issues, utilizing enhanced problem-solving skills to determine true root cause and to develop and implement irreversible corrective actions. Work closely with the sourcing area teams and BD teams to develop strategic sourcing plans that align to the Supplier Performance Management Processes and procedures. Accountability of cross-functional initiatives Procurement policy accomplishment Attend business needs and show business opportunities through external partnerships and external productions Usage of procurement tools – Zycus as main tools to safeguard bidding information. Education / Certifications: Bachelors degree Job specific requirements: Minimum 5 years of experience in Procurement or Supply Chain Travel requirements: 15% within US Work schedule: From Monday to Friday. Hybrid model role. No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. jobTitle: Sourcing Specialist External Manufacturing , Procurement NA
jobDescription: Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter. This is an exciting role where you will learn to use market insights and data analysis to work with different partners to start and shape new market trends. You will support the development and execution of sourcing strategies for spend categories and support the continuous improvement and standardization of the strategic sourcing processes How You Will Contribute You support spend category teams to develop and execute sourcing strategies for specific spend categories. To excel in this role, you interact with cross-functional stakeholders to manage spend and market analytics (for example, conducting “make or buy” analyses). You also generate insights from bid events, prepare supplier negotiation materials, support project execution and supplier relationship management, and drive controls and compliance. What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career with experience and knowledge in: Procurement Data Analytics – ability to analyze and visualize large amounts of data Supply market analysis experience preferred Project management Negotiating, influencing and building collaborative relationships More About This Role What you need to know about this position: Procurement: You’ll help create a competitive advantage for Mondelēz International by building winning supplier partnerships and effectively managing all company resources. Working with the businesses, you and your team will drive sustainable top and bottom-line growth through supplier innovation, best-in-class margin and cash management, and highly efficient source-to-pay processes. Job Scope: Procurement is a global function within the organization and aspiring to demonstrate competitive advantage through wining Supplier Partnership and Effective Management of All Company Spend. The global spend is uniformly consolidated into 5-Spend Areas (Raw Materials, Packing Materials, Logistics and Manufacturing, Sales and Marketing and Business Services and IT). External Manufacturing (EM) team is part of Logistics and Manufacturing Spend Area and is responsible for cost effective sourcing of portfolio of branded finished products (FP) from “contract manufacturers” (CoMs) or “contract-repackers” (Re-pack) in compliance with Mondelēz International food safety, quality and service level expectations. This function is significantly important to the Biscuits and Confectionary Categories’ growth agenda. Yearly, EM is challenged to create external supply solutions and timely execute New Product launches representing more than 15% of annual Net Revenue growth. This role will support the development, execution of sourcing strategies for External Manufacturing Spend Areas and provide operational support during SRM. Sourcing Specialist will assist Spend Areas to drive sustainable top and bottom-line growth through supplier innovation, best-in-class margin and cash management, and highly efficient source-to-pay processes .The key activities include market analytics, cost cards, spend & payment terms, contract database management, supports Spend Areas preparing sourcing events and working with Sourcing Analyst Pool, generating insights from bid events, preparing supplier negotiation materials, supporting project execution and supplier relationship management, and driving controls and compliance. Sourcing Specialist will work in all procurement systems, updating information records and maintaining documents renewals (Zycus, VoLT, team site, etc.) Key Responsibilities: Assist Spend Area Managers with preparation, analysis and execution of sourcing practices Define requirements and templates for analytics and market intelligence support from the Sourcing Analyst Pool. Analyze spend baseline, Spend Area profile, and market insights to support development of Spend Area and EM strategies. Execute end-to-end sourcing projects in alignment with the Spend Area Managers Manage the Procurement strategy implementation or sourcing execution Support during NPD launches Support Spend Area Managers in stakeholders’ management Maintain operational excellence for EM Spend Area Manage cost cards for EMs: analyze, update, compare, improve, implement single templates for all EMs, implement automation Prepare various analytics on the regular basis and during finance planning cycles Maintain SRM, manage score cards, organize and prepare regular meetings Support production by leading problem solving on supply issues and coordinating responses between EM Operations, EMs, suppliers, MDLZ stakeholders and LPRs. Support productivity agenda: lead productivity tracking file, update VOLT, manage productivity agenda as per agreed cross -functional governance Support DPO agenda in close collaboration with Spend Area Manage compliance: update Zycus, maintain EM team site, drive compliance agenda, update compliance tracker Assist in driving supplier performance Monitor, control and report KPIs to Spend Area Build regional best practices, exchange experience with other regions Internal/External Contacts: External: Peer Network EMs Accounts payable teams Internal: EM Operations, BDs, Finances, Planners, PCMs, Raw and Packaging Spend Areas, LPRs, RD&Q, Marketing, Sourcing Analyst Pool KPIs: Productivity Projects execution DPO $ Purchase Price Variance (SAP-Cost Cards- Pos- Invoices) Audit Compliance Target\dimensions: Deliver AC productivity projects to schedule Activate Supply Chain Financing Deliver Operational KPIs Green audits Education / Certifications: Bachelor’s Degree in business, Economics or Finances Job specific requirements: Minimum 1-year of experience in Procurement or Supply Chain or Sales. Ability to analyze diverse data sets Ability to work with multiple priorities Work schedule: From Monday to Friday. Hybrid model role. Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country.
